OVERALL SUMMARY: Reports to the Senior Manager of Business Continuity and Crisis Management (BCCM). The BCCM Team helps to prepare employees for unplanned events. It is comprised of the Crisis Command (CCT) and Business Continuity Management (BCM) Teams. The CCT consists of senior level executives who are responsible for the overall safety and welfare of staff members and our organizational assets. The BCM Team works with employees to develop contingency plans, training initiatives, rehearsals and awareness campaigns to ensure that HBO’s business can continue to operate once an unforeseen event has been mitigated. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES : Support Senior Manager in the development, enhancement and maintenance of Business Continuity Plans (BCPs) with Owners. Ensure Plans components are updated timely/accurately and follow up with subject matter experts and Plan Owners, per audit standards Prepare and analyze quarterly metrics and BCM status reports for Executive Steering and Advisory Committees, as needed Design, develop and deliver educational materials including unique methodologies for tabletop, gaming and e-learning platforms Implement and administer enterprise-wide BCM Planning software (Fusion) With Senior Manager, conduct periodic Business Impact Analysis (BIA) including evaluating results within the Fusion planning tool With Senior Manager, conduct risk assessments (vendor and location risk assessments within Fusion) Participate in development of materials and meeting minutes for Advisory Committee meetings Conduct training sessions for our BC Community (Plan Owners and Administrators) Prepare agendas and coordinate plans for BCCM related meetings Support the Director and Senior Manager as needed in global expansion of BCM program Cross-train in Crisis Management Analyst role, as needed REQUIREMENTS: Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience Excellent verbal and written skills Candidate must be a team player in a highly collaborative environment Ability to work with employees at all levels of the organization Advanced MS Office suite skills required (Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint) Strong organizational skills, detailed-oriented and a team player Ability to work independently while supporting multiple projects. Must be available to work evening and weekend hours, on short notice, as needed should an unforeseen event occur Strong interest in the field of Business Continuity Planning and/or Crisis Management Experience with Fusion or other integrated BC Planning tools a plus Experience with Emergency Notification messaging tools a plus Bachelor’s degree required DRII Certification a plus

Job Description Essential Functions Creation and upkeep of process automation related to data maintenance. Complete documentation of datasets and processes following established industry standards Coordination of some short- and long-term projects including the organization, prioritization, review, evaluation and approval of project deliverables. Occasional oversight of subordinate and interning employees Preparation of written and oral reports, memos, visualizations and presentations to communicate project objectives or outcomes and the results of spatial or statistical analyses to executives, non-technical staff, and the public. Communication and explanation of technical issues, spatial concepts, data and methods to non-technical staff. Query and maintenance of spatial and non-spatial data within relational databases Writing of database views to support new and ad hoc reports and providing guidance to analysts on database analysis. Creation, management and editing of APIs of departmental data for internal and external uses. Engaging departmental (business or operational) stakeholders to define the objectives, goals, deadlines and deliverables for projects and prioritize ad hoc requests for maps and reports. Coordination with OIT on the creation, maintenance and update to spatial and non-spatial databases Execution and support of City policies for enterprise data sharing, data quality, metadata, spatial data updates/maintenance and open data sharing to the public. Coordination with OIT on the implementation of new technology, innovations or data management policies. Ensuring the complete documentation of projects, datasets and processes. Bunker Hill Insurance Company is the home insurance affiliate of Plymouth Rock. Bunker Hill writes homeowner’s and renter’s insurance exclusively. Homeowners insurance knowledge is preferred. Experience with web-based applications, insurance systems, agency interface, database query tools, MS suite of products and strong analytical skills required. The Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $1 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. Date Opened: 2018-08-02 Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. ENTERTAINING IS OUR PASSION EA was founded over 30 years ago by individuals with a deep passion for making games. Many things have changed over the years as the gaming industry—and the company—has expanded immensely, but we are still driven by the same passion for developing, publishing, and distributing the world’s best games. Our history has been one of great success, and our future looks even brighter. Gaming has come a long way from Pac-Man & Space Invaders to modern EA favorites like Burnout, Battlefield, Mercenaries, Dead Space, Spore, FIFA, Madden, Need for Speed and the world’s most successful game franchise, The Sims. Fuelled by our talented staff at locations right across the Globe we are united in our passion to continue shaping the future of interactive entertainment. Together we can make a difference. _Business Analyst – Global Brand Partnerships_ Role Overview EA’s Global Brand Partnerships team is searching for a Business Analyst that will play a pivotal role in providing business intelligence to the Global Brand Partnerships’ management team and business partners. The Business Analyst will report directly to the Director of Business Management, and the successful candidate will have an analytical background and be familiar with desktop, mobile, and digital advertising. The Business Analyst will combine that experience with data analysis to provide key business insights that will help the Global Brand Partnership team expand its rapidly growing advertising business, and maximize its revenue potential. Key responsibilities include: Preparing standard KPI & ad hoc reports for GBP management, and key business partners Analyzing data and trends to make recommendations to the team on product implementation, and business strategies Forecasting advertising revenue for annual and quarterly fiscal planning, as well as for new ad products and opportunities Reviewing data to identify issues as quickly as possible Partnering with external business partners to improve the flow of data to EA Leading initiatives to automate and streamline reporting processes Building and maintaining strong relationships with business partners Required Skills: Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree 3-5 years prior work experience in an analytical role Strong MS Excel skills Familiarity with gaming and digital media Experience with forecasting Comfortable dealing with large sets of data from multiple sources Strong analytical, strategic, and creative problem-solving skills Ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects with tight deadlines Thorough understanding of digital advertising ecosystem, monetization trends, technologies and pricing models Strong decision-making, organizational, and planning skills with proven ability to identify and prioritize critical issues Thoroughness and high attention to detail Solid interpersonal skills to build key relationships with partners Ability to work both independently as well as a strong team player Cross Platform experience – Mobile, Desktop, & Console EA is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

This hourly (non-exempt) position is responsible for the various tasks required to support multiple delivery channels including Self Service products and Branch Operations. This individual will work closely with staff to solve issues related to various channels and act as an escalation point in resolving issues. Contact with outside vendors is necessary to work through testing, implementation and support of various channels. This position can work at another location within our branch network, following a 3-6 month training period and contingent upon desk availability at the preferred office location. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Work as key escalation point of issues that cannot be resolved by customer contact individuals. This includes responding to support tickets, working through the issue to determine the source, and finding resolution. Develop test scripts for various delivery channels to ensure a thorough test is completed before any changes are made. Once testing is complete, reporting outcome of the test and recommendations for changes or implementation. Perform key tasks associated with the support of the products assigned. This includes performing daily report analysis; assigning tasks to others for completion and subsequent follow up; performing maintenance and responding to customer inquiries as necessary. Create documentation of processes and procedures related to the various channels being supported. Work with the team to evaluate data provided by various systems and determine appropriate courses of action. Implement changes with other business units. QUALIFICATIONS: College degree in finance, marketing, business administration or a related discipline preferred. Minimum 3-5 years banking experience with a major concentration in direct delivery of Retail Operations. Thorough understanding of the operational aspects of the various channels supported and their systems. Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to set priorities to achieve short and long time goals. Proven abilities in data analysis and issue resolution. Strong documentation and procedural skills required. Highly developed verbal and written communication skills are essential. Excellent computer skills (i.e. Word, PowerPoint and Excel spreadsheet applications) and an understanding of other bank applications (Core account application, general ledger, ACH, and other cash management systems). Travel to meetings, training and seminars as scheduled. May also require some travel between Elk Grove and various branches. Typical hours are Monday through Friday 8am-5pm, may require some weekends, and evenings. First American Bank will not sponsor applicants for work visas. _First American Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans)._

Summary of Position The Business Analyst is the liaison between cross-functional teams and is responsible for supporting the development of divisional improvement initiative projects from conception through deployment, inclusive of analysis, requirements definition, testing, and dissemination of project information. This individual should be able to bring abstract concepts of business intelligence (BI) to general understanding for the company. The Business Analyst is also responsible for preparing reports to be used for ongoing key performance initiatives, optimization of processes and reports, as well as data sets that are utilized for monthly financial performance and operational analysis. Essential Functions Physical presence in the office to accomplish these tasks, meet and work with others Subject matter expert of divisional operations and systems. Develops and maintains business line performance reporting. Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, tasks and workflow analysis. Execute analytical projects in support of business line operations. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and maintain business processes effectively. Utilize your experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies required. Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. Defines, builds and manages processes to enhance the value of internal and external data. Develops functional requirements of systems to improve quality, performances, external interfaces and constraints. Strong analytical and project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Work closely with IS development team and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs. Develops functional requirements of systems to improve quality, performances, external interfaces and constraints. Outline requirement specifications with the use of standard templates. Establishes responsible deadlines and personal work plans and manages time effectively. Review requirements with the business, elicit feedback, integrate feedback into requirements as necessary. Conduct user acceptance testing to ensure the system can be used easily, quickly and accurately and that all identified requirements have been met. Perform other duties as assigned. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, or sit for up to eight hours; use hands to manipulate or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift or move office products and supplies, up to twenty pounds. Experience Required At least 3 years’ experience. Experience working with internal and external customers. Demonstrated experience with current systems analysis principles, methods, procedures, tools and techniques. Proven ability to communicate effectively with displayed levels of knowledge, skills and responsibilities. Education Required Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics or related field.

FBAP - i2TMS - Ryder Online - Transportation Intelligence System Initiates continuous process improvement activities and monitors results Execute analysis and data preparation in support of sales activities Provide all support function activity including accuracy and timeliness of data processing, reporting, analysis, and all other customer specific inquiries Cohesively work with internal SME(s) to resolve problems and/or support implementations Process and distribute weekly customer metrics and develop customer performance reports Ability to interact with clients in resolving problems and coordinating implementations Participate in TM Kaizen activities as Subject Matter Expert ___Ryder is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free workplace. Guided by a visionary new strategic plan, Woodland Park Zoo (WPZ) is embarking on a period of great change and innovation. A key focus area is using actionable and predictive information to facilitate business decisions and make strategic recommendations for process improvements. In concert with key internal business units, the Business Intelligence Analyst/Developer is responsible for driving insights for Woodland Park Zoo’s Advancement division (Development, Content and Creative Strategy, Membership, Marketing, Advocacy and Public Affairs) through reporting and analysis to maximize constituent engagement, identify trends and ensure the long-term financial performance and impact of the organization. Reporting to the Associate Director, Relationship Data Services, this position will primarily focus on the reporting and analysis needs of the Development department and Content and Creative Strategy department, while working collaboratively with other WPZ departments. This position requires excellent skills in gathering, analyzing, and reporting data, often originating from multiple sources. Position requires an innovative, proactive, creative, highly motivated, team-oriented individual who has a high degree of initiative and independent judgment. Requires a positive and customer focused business approach focused on meeting current and future needs where data and knowledge derived from data will play a critical role in organizational decision making. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Create, develop, test, document and interpret consistent, relevant data insights to help guide the organization via accurate reporting, dashboards, analysis, and custom-built tools to deliver accurate and timely results. Coordinate, deploy and ensure the accuracy of standardized periodic reports, automating the process as appropriate Establish and maintain partnerships and synergies with other information and analytics teams, including but not limited to IT, Admissions, Finance, Conservation and Education departments. Oversee the day-to-day management and operation of the ODS for The Raiser’s Edge database. Use a variety of tools including Google Analytics and product dashboards as well as internal and external research resources to aggregate and synthesize data trends and insights across platforms. Monitor industry trends and implement best practices for continuous improvement of in-house capabilities and customer support. Advise collaborators on best practices in forming research questions and analysis strategies. Create user documentation. Initiate processing and record management procedural changes as needed. Keep all policies and procedural documents updated. Safeguard the confidentiality of donor information at all times. Maintain and adhere to policies around information gathering and sharing in accordance with professional ethics standards. Perform other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE Required: Bachelor's degree (B.S. or B.A.) from an accredited four-year college or university, as well as two (2) years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Passion for data. Great analytical skills. Able to define problems, establish facts, draw valid conclusions and provide actionable recommendations that support short term goals and considers long term process. Proven ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks/requests simultaneously under time constraints, and meet deadlines in a professional manner. Full data lifecycle perspective (requirements gathering through production deployment and support) in aspects of SQL Server, Microsoft Business Intelligence solutions, Tableau, SSRS and Crystal Reports. Proficiency of MS SQL Server Relational Database Management software including T-SQL. Established experience with SSIS package Design, Development, Testing and Troubleshooting for data migration. Knowledge of entity-relationship models and data normalization. Working experience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics. Strong listening, written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate technical ideas verbally and in writing to non-technical staff. Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and maintain the professional and ethical standards set forth for the field by the Association of Professional Researchers for Advancement (APRA), Association of Advancement Services Professionals (AASP) and Association of Fundraising Professionals (AFP). Commitment to the mission of the zoo and the institution’s Core Values. Desired: Experience with The Raiser’s Edge, Omatic Software products and point of sale systems. Knowledge of fundraising operations and data management. Working knowledge of e-commerce, SEO, SEM, email and other online marketing optimization activities. Advanced Excel skills, including complex spreadsheets, pivot tables, and data manipulation. Experience using statistical analysis techniques and building regression and/or predictive models. Experience with automation tools. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This job has no supervisory responsibilities. LANGUAGE ABILITY Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. MATHEMATICAL ABILITY Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. REASONING ABILITY Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Ability to recall, recognize and communicate interrelated information pertaining to Zoo benefactors and members. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This job is performed in a typical office environment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. APPLICATION DIRECTIONS Applications are only accepted online through our Jobs page at www.zoo.org; no other forms of application will be accepted. Cover letter and resume are REQUIRED when applying for this position. NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE. APPLICATION DEADLINE: This position will remain posted until filled; priority will be given to applications received prior to August 26th, 2018. _Woodland Park Zoo is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, disability, veteran’s status, sexual orientation, or gender identity/expression._

The Business Analyst has the primary responsibility to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the real needs of the project stakeholders, including customers and end users. The business analyst serves as the conduit between the customer community and the software development team through which requirements flow. This role performs advanced business analysis work. A business analyst is involved at some level throughout the entire software development life cycle. Upon establishment of the requirements baseline, the focus is shifted towards the management of the requirements specification and verifying the fulfillment of all requirements. This position will support the suite of applications that make up the Educator Certification Systems and other TEA applications. The Educator Certification System is a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software application that tracks the certification of a Texas educator through the credentialing process and beyond. As this application is currently in production, this position focuses not only on new enhancements or modifications that are needed, but also on daily production support activities. Work involves analyzing user requirements and fully documenting reported problems and needed system enhancements while considering limitations. Individuals work under minimal supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Additional Military Crosswalk (occupational specialty code) information can be accessed at: http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx. Essential Job Functions: Work with the project manager or project sponsor to document the product's vision and the project's scope. Support existing applications by analyzing problem reports from application owners to determine if the problem is an application defect, misunderstanding of application functionality or a needed system enhancement. Communicate results effectively with an emphasis on customer service by summarizing the problem reported, analysis conducted, findings and/or proposed solution. Identify project stakeholders and user classes. Document user class characteristics. Identify appropriate representatives for each user class and negotiate their responsibilities. Organize and facilitate joint application development (JAD) sessions or meets one-on-one with internal customers to elicit system requirements. Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints. Write requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely. Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements and quality, specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those must base their work on the requirements. Define quality attributes, external interfaces, constraints, and other nonfunctional requirements. Transform information from customer sessions into functional and system requirements documented in either a software requirements specification (SRS) utilizing use cases, textual descriptions and UML diagrams. Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards. Participate in requirements prioritization. Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents. Participate in peer reviews of work products derived from requirements specifications to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly. Enter, manipulate and report on requirements stored in a commercial requirements management tool. Define requirement attributes and facilitate their use throughout the project. Manage requirements traceability information and track requirements status throughout the project. Manage changes to baselined requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools. Work collaboratively with the development team and testers to clarify or resolve requirements questions and issues. Develop and distribute system release notes and coordinate customer acceptance testing working with the Project Manager and Technical Lead. Assist in the training users on the use of the system as well the development and verification of all system user documentation. Organize and facilitate customer acceptance testing. Establish and implement effective requirements practices, including use and continuous improvement of a requirements process. Assist with the development of the organization's requirements engineering policies, procedures, and tools. Implement ways to reuse requirements across projects. May develop and execute testing scenarios. May plan, assign, and/or supervise the work of others. May be assigned high-priority special projects or requests that need to be completed within a short time frame. Perform related tasks as assigned by the direct supervisor. Work under limited supervision with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. May need to work outside the normal work hours to accommodate other duties or tasks assigned. Minimum Qualifications: Education: Graduation from an accredited four year college or university with major course work in computer science, management information systems, business administration or a related field is required. Experience: Five (5) years experience in deriving requirements from interviews with customers and creating system requirements documents based on the interviews. Prefer experience with analyzing existing applications to determine solutions for problems reported by customer as well as collecting requirements for requested enhancements. Work experience in conducting a complete and detailed analysis of business process. We prefer experience with requirements management tools like Compuware Optimal Trace and UML modeling tools such as Enterprise Architect. Substitution: Each additional year of experience above the required minimum may substitute for education on a year for year basis. Travel: Less than 10% required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs): Knowledge of: An understanding of contemporary requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, verification, and management practices and the ability to apply them in practice; familiarity with requirements engineering books and resources. An understanding of how to practice requirements engineering according to several software development life cycles in a team environment. A solid understanding of database structures. Knowledge of product management concepts and how enterprise software products are positioned and developed. Application domain knowledge is a plus to have credibility with user representatives and be able to work effectively with them. Skill in: Interviewing skills, to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to elicit essential requirements information. Listening skills, to understand what people say and to detect what they might be hesitant to say. Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs and distinguish solution ideas from requirements. Facilitation skills, to lead requirements elicitation workshops. Observational skills, to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas for elicitation. Writing skills, to communicate information effectively to customers, marketing, managers, and technical staff. Organizational skills, to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information. Interpersonal skills, to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among project stakeholders (such as customers, product management, and engineering). Modeling skills, to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment textual representations in natural language, including using modeling languages already established in the development organization. Ability to: Translate business plans and requirements into information systems concepts. Assimilate input from many different sources and present concise recommendations. Communicate technical concepts to professional, non-technical clients. Adapt to the agency's Software Development Life Cycle as it pertains to what the business analyst needs to provide. Adapt to using tools adopted by the agency for providing business analysis services. Work independently to research requirements and follow established standards for end products. Work constructively as part of a team to coordinate with developers and business users to analyze system characteristics. Adapt to using tools adopted by the agency for providing business analysis services. Work independently to research requirements and follow established standards for end products. Work constructively as part of a team to coordinate with developers and business users to analyze system characteristics. Overview Who we are: Meridian Health Plan is a family-owned, family-operated company of passionate leaders, achievers, and innovators dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our members, our providers and in the healthcare industry. We provide government-based health plans (Medicare, Medicaid, and the Health Insurance Marketplace) in five different states (Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, and Ohio). Our employees work hard, play hard, and give back. Meridian employees enjoy: Happy hours, special events, company sports teams, potlucks, Bagel Fridays, weekly Executive Lunches, and volunteer opportunities. A Day in the Life of a Business Analyst: The Business Analyst position is primarily responsible for requirements gathering, requirements analysis, impact assessment, and creation of Business Requirements documents and Functional Specifications for system development projects of various size and complexity. The Business Requirement documents are at a detailed level, including related functional requirements, use cases, testing considerations and functional solution design. This position collaborates with Business Leads and subject matter experts, Delivery Leads, Architects, vendors, and technical resources on a regular basis throughout the project delivery lifecycle. The Business Analyst 2 is responsible for adhering to corporate software development standards and methodologies. Secondary responsibilities include creation and maintenance of various types of documents, testing support, issue investigation, analysis, and resolution, and assisting in responding to new corporate initiatives and work requests as needed. Responsibilities Collaborate with the business units and/or external clients in the definition and documentation of project scope, and identification and documentation of project risks and assumptions Participates in the work estimation process Performs business process analysis and process modeling and participates in the development of strategies for process enhancements Solicits and documents business and functional requirements and additional artifacts such as Use Cases to define client needs/wants Performs data mining and data analysis as needed for research and to support the development of required artifacts Manages business requirements documents throughout all project phases and ensures departmental compliance with audit-required processes Participates in architecting the logical design of system functional solutions with the developers and architects, including screen design and specifications, data modeling, and documentation of logical processing flows Responsible for facilitating/brokering communication between the business customers and the technical team Establishes and maintains traceability between business and functional requirements and artifacts in accordance with department guidelines Mocks up screens per agreed-upon functional design and transfers these designs to functional specifications Communicates with development and QA teams regularly to ensure accurate understanding and interpretation of requirements and other produced artifacts such as functional specifications Collaborates with QA teams in the execution of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) Assists in the preparation of user training materials based on approved functional specifications; assist or conduct training sessions as assigned Participates in Quality Assurance testing as necessary Provides post implementation production support including problem triage, analysis, and resolution Researches, reviews, and analyzes existing processes; develop improvement strategies Assists Delivery Lead in the creation and maintenance of project plans and project status reports Qualifications What you can bring to Meridian: Bachelor’s degree required Must pass the MHP Analyst Assessment Two to three (2 - 3) years’ Information Technology experience as a business/systems analyst, programmer, designer, or QA Analyst required At least two (2) years’ experience in large scale system implementation efforts using a standard software lifecycle methodology Proven experience with business requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, and impact assessment; requirements management with Use Cases desired Proven experience in client requirements/needs analysis and ability to interpret those requirements as they pertain to existing company systems/processes is required Experience working with data structures such as relational databases, XML, fixed length, and delimited files Data mining, analysis, definition and data mapping experience Health care insurance experience preferred What Meridian can offer you: Our healthcare benefits include a variety of PPO plans that are effective on the first day of employment for our new full-time team members. Opportunity to work with the industry’s leading technologies and participate in unique projects, demonstrations, conferences, and exclusive learning opportunities. Meridian offers 401k matching that is above the national average. Full-time MHP employees are eligible for tuition reimbursement towards Bachelor’s or Master’s degrees. Meridian Health Plan was named Detroit's 1 Fastest Growing Company by Crain's Magazine, so it is a great time to get involved with Meridian. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER MSTR

To be successful, you must be customer focused, be able to clearly define and communicate business needs, and be personally driven to improve the business. Responsibilities: Lead requirements elicitation and documentation for one or more projects Develop business process models, business requirements/user stories (functional and non-functional) and product backlog Collaborates with Project Manager on project plans, schedule and work breakdown structure for projects Maintains project interlock tracking and provides status reports to senior business leadership Identifies and proactively resolves issues/conflicts within the project and business team. Communicates project status, progress on deliverables, and risks/issues to business stakeholders and leadership in a timely manner Lead and guide the business community to ensure comprehensive user acceptance testing/training plans are developed/executed and application is successfully transitioned into production Demonstrate a thorough understanding of business processes, best practices, and available supporting technology and service providers Troubleshoot problems and resolve issues Investigate and learn business issues and data challenges, and develop plans to improve Support IT Strategy Development Serve as the liaison between the Business community and Development & Sustain teams Assist Business with Problem and Incident Management Deliver project business value/return on investment Minimum Qualifications: Bachelors Degree in Business, IT, Engineering, or related Demonstrated in-depth understanding of Business Process fundamentals; including requirements elicitation, stakeholder collaboration, effective and timely communications, and problem-solving skills Demonstrated strength in critical skills such as collaboration, written and oral communications, and analytical capability Expert at documenting business processes using industry best practices and standard tools (flowcharts, activity/interaction diagrams) Planning, negotiation and facilitation skills Ability to multi-task and manage multiple initiatives without direct supervision In-depth understanding of business issues and data challenges of the organization and industry as a whole Demonstrates critical skills such as collaboration, strong written and verbal communication skills and analytical capability. Strong time management skills Preferred Qualifications: Masters degree in Business, IT, or related Experience in IT project management, requirements definition, process definition, testing, and IT strategy and roadmap development. Experience with Dealer Business Processes Experience in troubleshooting and resolving issues Development experience Experience with Agile development methodologies PMP Certified Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) certification Strong Communication (verbal and writing) and analytical skills Expertise in utilizing requirements tools

The Sponsored Programs Business Analyst for Washington State University’s Finance Systems Modernization Initiative develops and implements process improvement initiatives, which includes working collaboratively with an energized team of WSU finance and HR experts and consultants to implement Workday for WSU. Responsibilities will include developing a wide range of expertise in WSU accounting and finance processes with a focus on Sponsored Programs. Also will design new processes and configure Sponsored Programs work streams in the new finance system to help improve systems that support all research at WSU. The incumbent will prepare personnel for new systems and updates and serve as an expert sponsored programs systems and process resource and will work with university stakeholder groups as a lead or participant in design workgroups. The successful candidate will have experience in research administration, a strong understanding of accounting principles and processes, a high level of comfort using and/or supporting a complex accounting system and passion for supporting change in our research finance system. Additional Information University Overview Founded as the people’s university in 1890, Washington State University fulfills that commitment by transforming lives through education, research, and community outreach. In 2015, the University celebrated 125 years of delivering life-changing knowledge and discoveries to citizens across the state, region, nation, and around the world. The state’s only land-grant institution and one of two public research universities, WSU provides a world- class education to nearly 30,000 students through its multi-campus, statewide locations and online. The University strives to ensure that higher education is accessible at an affordable cost—a decades-long WSU commitment to the state’s citizens. The University offers more than 200 undergraduate fields of study and 127 graduate and professional degree programs. Many academic programs win recognition nationally for excellence. WSU is one of just 108 public and private universities in the United States—out of more than 4,500—singled out for its “very high research activity” by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching. The University’s research agenda is focused on addressing challenges in health, sustainability, smart systems, national security, and opportunity and equity. WSU is a major driver of Washington’s economy, partnering with many of the state’s leading industries, including agribusiness, aerospace, health care, software, and construction. The University is responsible for nearly 20,600 jobs statewide and generates an overall economic impact of more than $3.3 billion annually. The institution’s operating budget expenditures total nearly $2 billion annually. The City Pullman is a dynamic center of higher education, research, and culture located in a region called the Palouse. The region is home to two land grant universities, Washington State University and the University of Idaho located just eight miles to the east in Moscow, Idaho. Washington’s second-largest city, Spokane, is located 75 miles north of Pullman. Demographics Daily designated Pullman a “dreamtown,” reflecting the city’s exceptionally high quality of life. Bloomberg Businessweek named Pullman the “Best Places to Raise Your Kids” in Washington. The city also boasts one of the highest percentages of graduate degrees among U.S. micropolitan areas, and its public school system has been ranked among the top 100 in the country. Excellent outdoor recreation opportunities—including golfing, skiing, hiking, and boating—are just a short drive away. Additional Requirements Related degrees include Finance, Accounting, or other Business fields. Demonstrated effective interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills. Demonstrated sensitivity to, and desire to promote, diversity. Demonstrated proficiency in the use of computers and software applications. A record showing commitment to customer service and the application of appropriate flexibility in response to issues and opposing points of view. Demonstrated ability to successfully prepare and present policy interpretations, findings, and conclusions. CBRE | FacilitySource provides an innovative, technology-driven, single-source facility management and support solution to leading brands in retail, banking, logistics, health care and many other sectors. CBRE | FacilitySource maintains the industry’s largest and most reliable data repository to provide business intelligence, transparency, flexibility, support and the Elite Network of Service Providers to save money for our clients and get the most out of their facilities, while offering peace of mind. Established in 2005, CBRE | FacilitySource was acquired by CBRE Group, Inc., the largest commercial real estate services and investment firm in the world, in 2018. For more information, visit http://www.facilitysource.com/. POSITION SUMMARY: The Business Analyst is a technically competent generalist, with experience in business analysis within an application development environment. The successful candidate will be flexible, innovative, creative, curious, and analytical. The Business Analyst will take on several roles, so this job is ideal for a person having a broad skill set. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop/update business processes and templates Document requirements for assigned projects Develop functional workflows and other process workflows as needed Work with all departments involved in client implementations and upgrades to ensure custom development, and core-product development is completed per the documented requirements Review with training department workflows and customizations to ensure training and training material is tailored to the end-user Evaluate and apply information harvested through surveys and workshops, task analysis, and business process descriptions Be an interface and a go-between for technology teams, support teams, and business units for assigned projects Work with quality assurance and development team members to ensure test plans and project outcomes meet requirements and acceptance criteria Participate in client/AM weekly conference calls to gather input on how applications are being used, challenges that arise and opportunities to propose new ideas for development SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS: Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Experience collecting, managing and implementing business requirements and translating them into specific software requirements Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong customer focus and demonstrated ability to work in geographically dispersed teams; able to communicate with people at all skill and knowledge levels; able to translate technical concepts into plain English Ability to manage competing priorities in a dynamic and fast-growth environment Understanding both technical designs and specifications Must have strong computer skills and be proficient in use of Microsoft Office applications and Project Management tools EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business, or related discipline 3+ years hands-on experience in an application development environment and a track record as a successful Business Analyst Experience in multiple SDLC environments, especially Scrum CBAP – Certified Business Analysis Professional preferred Hands-on experience in two or more of the following skill-sets: Application development Architecture and systems design Business case, business value and ROI analysis Facilitation and requirements elicitation Managing projects as a project coordinator or project manager

The Construction Products Sector offers indoor and outdoor building solutions to improve the quality of living: plaster products, acoustic and thermal insulation, facade cladding, roofing, and pipes. It is present in 62 countries with more than 46,000 employees. We are looking for a Business Strategy Analyst to focus on building a sustainable new product development pipeline. The Analyst’s role will be to identify needs of the business and offer perspective about the future of the organization given its value proposition, resources, and place among competitors. The Analyst will explore product and business development opportunities, evaluate past and present facts, predict future product trends and deliver targeted proposals on the right next steps. The Analyst will also articulate possible alternatives for a way forward and assist the business platform teams with developing business cases offering recommendations as part of strategy. Keys to success in this role will be: Understanding the businesses to support identification of alternative strategies. Investigate products and opportunities that require a clear strategy. Ensuring that recommended changes are in line with the business strategy. Job Responsibilities: Conduct research on market insights, business opportunities, industry trends, competing organizations, customer demographics, new technologies, etc. Perform business analysis and reporting for assigned projects. Build positive and trustful working relationships with stakeholders throughout the organization. Maintain clear and complete knowledge on business operations and procedures. Track and record metrics, data and statistics, detailed notes of work for the company’s long-term use. Work with management to identify business needs, challenges and opportunities. Determine business roadmap and provide support in future business planning. Analyze business needs and develop strategies to meet these needs. Develop action plans to overcome business challenges. Recommend new technologies, new materials and product improvements based on market and competitive trends. Identify and develop new business opportunities for company growth. The Analyst needs to be goal oriented, highly motivated and thrive off of constant analysis and improvement. The person must have the ability to effortlessly switch between evaluating the company as a whole and evaluating small and detailed pieces of data. In addition to these general traits and abilities, we are looking for a person with the following skills: Attention to Detail Multitasking Interpersonal and Communication Skills Problem Solving Quantitative analysis Ability to Work Independently As such, the capacity to work with numbers and an interest in using data to answer questions is crucial. The person should be skilled in practicing various research methodologies and able to balance the information gathering and human resources aspects of strategic business analysis. The role also requires powerful motivational and communication skills in order to successfully interact with a variety of project stakeholders who may have competing interests. Due to the term limit, the person must be able to quickly size up a business and develop a rapport with others. Proficiency with Microsoft Office and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools is also appreciated.

PURPOSE OF POSITION The Massachusetts State Retirement Board (MSRB) administers a defined benefit retirement plan (Massachusetts State Employees Retirement System) for eligible employees and retirees of the Commonwealth and certain independent entities. The Business Analyst will be responsible for assisting in the continued support and implementation associated with the functionality, operation and maintenance of the Massachusetts Retirement Information System (MARIS) and work directly on site with MSRB and vendor staff. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES Serve as a liaison between MARIS users and development teams whereby he/she assists in defining requirements to support agency(s) needs. Evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions. Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies. Lead meetings with subject matter experts (SMEs) to elicit, clarify, and confirm business requirements. Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements. Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Identify process improvements and facilitate reengineering of business process. Test application and data related issues prior to deployment for end user testing. Analyze, design, and verify complex data sets necessary to identify data quality issues and present results to stakeholders. Lead general application support and assist MSRB staff in areas including, system testing, configuration and functionality design, requirements analysis. Provide support in maintaining policies and guidelines related to implementation and operation of MARIS. Use SQL and database querying tools (e.g. TOAD) and PL/SQL to extract data from relational databases. Review tickets where appropriate either 1) resolve the issue, 2) replicate the issue in lower environments and 3) assign ticket for resolution. Provide inputs on developing project plans and monitoring performance. Other technical and programmatic responsibilities as requested by Project Manager. Qualifications KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS Bachelor’s Degree or higher. Strong preference is given for experience with pension administration or benefit claim systems. A minimum of 5 years’ experience in business analysis or a related field. Experience with CASE tools including rules engine (logical rules and decision tables), BPM, business intelligence, and screen prototyping a plus. A collaborative mindset with the ability to work in a team environment but also self-motivated to produce results with minimal direction. Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), including presentation skills as well as the ability to clearly articulate technical solutions to non-technical staff. Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills and the ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions. Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook. Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills. Familiarity with data warehousing/ETL concepts, including extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes. Experienced in full software development life cycle (SDLC) including requirements definition, prototyping, design, coding, testing and maintenance. Experience with Agile design methodology and SCRUM meeting facilitation a plus.

Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis that provides meaningful insights and synthesized recommendations to support informed decision-making Cooperate with data engineers to build up Yamibuy data platform, by understanding the business requirements and the data users’ needs. Develop dashboards that provide a clear view of the business by visually translating complex data into actionable insights. Present data related information succinctly and effectively to stakeholders and leadership Monitor published information regularly and follow-up timely when corrections are necessary to ensure reporting accuracy and integrity Understand basic finance and accounting Qualifications and Requirements: Minimum of 2 years business analyst or data analyst related experience Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Information Systems, Engineering or related field preferred, or a combination of education and equivalent work experience. Highly proficient in Excel Extract, cleanse and validate data using mySQL Experience developing reports and dashboards utilizing visualization tools Ability to perform analysis with data supported conclusions Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Problem solving and critical thinking skills Ability to organize and prioritize work, meet tight dead-lines Proponent of developing a data-driven culture and supporting other team member Understands data architecture within relational database environment is a plus Proficient in writing time efficient mySQL script is a plus Knowledge of using ETL tools, SSIS, and Alteryx is a plus Experience developing dashboards and reports with Tableau is a plus

And as a rapidly growing tech company, we are just getting started. The best candidate is a curious, committed learner who is also a data power user constantly seeking efficiencies. This individual is process oriented and thrives on solving problems. Responsibilities Collect, cleanse, organize data from multiple sources for analysis and reporting Optimize reporting processes for accuracy, repeatability and efficiency Create, publish and maintain reports and dashboards in SFDC and BI tools for various end users within the organization Create and publish monthly/quarterly/annual Sales KPIs and Trend Analysis for Sales Managers, Sales Leadership and Executive Team Support the sales organization in all their reporting and analytic needs Track actual performance across sales territories on a weekly basis Deliver actionable insights to help drive strategy and revenue Monitor data and system rules in SFDC to ensure data integrity QA new reporting features and implementations Partner with Sales Operations Manager in understanding meaning behind the numbers to strengthen analyses Collaborate cross-functionally within the organization to ensure delivery of actionable sales data and reporting Ad hoc analysis and reporting as needed Qualifications 2+ years of analysis experience Expert skills in Microsoft Excel and spreadsheet modeling Experience with Salesforce.com Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, preferred Knowledge of Relational Databases and SQL, preferred High attention to detail and accuracy Ability to identify and implement work process improvements Ability to take initiative, work flexibly, and adhere to priorities with minimal supervision. Strong aptitude to learn new things, positive attitude, ability to collaborate across departments and personalities

The AV Homes IT Business Analyst works with the business to analyze, prioritize, categorize and document business needs. The position is responsible for detailing business processes and collecting data on challenges and pain points. The Business Analyst assists the business with development and execution of user acceptance testing (UAT). The successful candidate should have an understanding of modern AV Homes applications, preferably JD Edwards or comparable ERP with the focus being on the modules of Finance, Home Builder Management and Home Builder Sales System. The individual should understand, or capable of quickly understanding, the home building industry, including buying, selling, constructing, building and servicing homes. The individual will need excellent written and oral communication skills as a primary task will be interviewing and interrogating business areas on challenges and pain points associated with current/as-is processes for managing home building. Deep business process knowledge is required to enable this individual to solicit, consolidate and synthesize feedback from process owners and subject matter experts to identify and prioritize AV Homes process improvement opportunities. Some essential functions of the job are as follows: Liaise with various departments to define and develop various management and financial reports and maintaining the integrity of the data these reports rely on. Facilitate ad hoc financial reporting and data extraction requests as required. Work with the IT team coordinating activities with the Project Team and functional leads to assist with the support of the ERP application. Assess future projects related to the current system. Troubleshoot issues related to set up and configuration. Maintain, develop and enhance documentation. Skills: Demonstrated ability to work independently and in a collaborative team environment. Demonstrated ability to produce clear, concise and accurate documentation detailing business processes and requirements. Excellent interpersonal skills including written and oral communications. Excellent organizational skills and the ability to work on more than one project at a time with exceptional attention to detail. Flexibility and adaptability to changing situations Education and Experience: A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Finance, Accounting or related field or equivalent experience

Hiring Salary Range $68,344 - $88,847/annually DOE Grade 120 Work Schedule Monday - Friday, 8am - 5pm; some evenings and weekends may be required Work Calendar 12 Months Job Summary This is a key role that will focus on driving the rollout, performing steady state administration, planning, and maintenance of ITSM-based tools, methodologies, and practices across the Maricopa Community Colleges District. This role will establish and maintain strong working relationships with stakeholders and partners (e.g., IT support teams, help desk teams across the District, project teams) to successfully drive adoption of new ITSM capabilities and rollout and sustain enterprise ITSM tools, services and methodologies in the District. Areas of importance and in-scope for this role include ITSM practice expertise, ITSM tools management and administration, stakeholder engagement, training and District-wide knowledge sharing, implementations, service catalog and service desk metrics, and analysis of business needs and services and the supporting ITSM capabilities in place to meet the requirements of internal customers. The IT Support Coordinator will play a key role as assist IT leaders and teams in entrenching a “business and service culture” across the Maricopa Community Colleges District. Essential Functions 50% - Serves as subject matter expert in the daily administration, management, and oversight of the enterprise ITSM tools (e.g., help desk system) and supporting ITSM practices, methodologies, and procedures in the Maricopa Community Colleges District; assists and/or leads in the preparation and collection of help desk-related reports and analysis, detailed specifications, requirements, scope documents and logic flowcharts for the development, implementation, management and administration of ITIL/ITSM tools, services, capabilities and methodologies – including working collaboratively with project managers and cross-functional teams in the development, update and execution of related project plans 15% - Conducts quality-control tests and analysis to ensure that ITSM tools, services, staff, methodologies, procedures and practices are established and meet or exceed specified standards and customer requirements; ensures complex project requirements are executable, testable, complete and not ambiguous; assists in the development, implementation and maintenance of testing strategies, plans, and data with valid and invalid records to thoroughly test ITSM-based systems, tools and services 10% - As required, leads and/or assists in the performing moderately complex research and validation with customers across the Maricopa Community Colleges District, including best practices, trend analysis, strategic planning, endorsement, communication/partnership with stakeholders, requirements analysis, implementation planning/rollouts, business process modeling, usability testing and contextual inquiry/analysis; analyzes and validates complex business, technology, systems and service management requirements and existing business processes and information systems, including functional validation and traceability and consensus building as required on IT and help desk teams 10% - As required, leads and/or assists in the negotiation, gaining buy-in for, the design, and maintenance of SLAs, SLOs, OLAs and related service desk metrics with partners inside the Information Technology Service organization and across the Maricopa Community Colleges District; responsible for providing reports on SLA compliance, service desk metrics including analysis, reviews and reporting of performance results against the criteria established in SLAs, SLOs and OLAs – includes setup and maintenance of help desk self-service portals and other online web sites and content updates related to the help desk system 10% - As required, leads and/or assists in the creation and maintenance of a Catalog of Services, including managing the catalog and relevant work queues in an enterprise level Service Desk tool; establish a service review process; planning, organizing and facilitating recurring meetings with partners and stakeholders in the Maricopa Community Colleges District – including designing, getting buy-in, maintaining, conducting frequent assessment and reviews of service level management (SLM) and ITSM processes 5% - Performs other duties as assigned Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in information technology or related field with four years of business systems analysis experience including business process design, business requirements definition, workflow documentation and acceptance testing OR An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above, unless otherwise subject to any other requirements set forth in law or regulation. Desired Qualifications 1\. Five (5) or more years of experience managing an Enterprise Service Desk 2\. Two (2) or more years of experience with ITSM tool suites, including planning, rollouts, use, implementation and migrations (e.g., SysAid, Remedy, ServiceNow, HPE ITSM Automation, Microsoft, BMC, IBM, CA Service Desk) 3\. Two (2) or more years of organizational change management experience 4\. The Senior Business Analyst also participates in larger T-Mobile projects and initiatives and provides requirements and suggestions based on Sales Channel data needs. This position works closely with the Sales Leadership and various other departments within T-Mobile. ad hoc reporting as needed Work closely with Senior management to define new analysis/reporting initiatives Cross-training as backup to other members on the team Detail oriented and insightful approach to data analysis, and reporting Committed to providing, world-class service to our partners and customers Proven ability to prioritize competing needs of multiple, rapidly evolving initiatives Ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment Demonstrated leadership ability Excellent verbal and written communication skills Flexibility to travel (depending on assignment) Able to work independently with limited supervision Qualifications: Minimum 2 years’ experience in a Business Analysis and/or Reporting Analysis role Intermediate computer skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project, Outlook, Visio) Intermediate experience with SQL (MS SQL Server, Teradata) Preferred Ability to design new technical solutions to enhance existing reports and tools Ability to draw conclusions, escalate issues and formulate recommendations Ability to analyze data and present findings and recommendations to Senior management Ability to apply data analysis to real-world business situations Proven ability to conceptualize from Big Picture down to detail level Proven ability to work effectively with Senior and Executive level management Knowledge of relational database, data modeling, systems design and integration PowerBI or Tableau experience a plus Wireless industry experience Financial reporting experience Project Management experience Software development experience Experience with enterprise software applications (POS, CRM, SAP, Content Management & Publishing, Billing Systems Education Bachelor’s Degree Preferred. The Apprentice Business Analyst will work as an integral part of a dynamic team along with peers and senior staff. This individual will support multiple projects, primarily facilitating both statewide Emergency Medical Services (EMS) and school based annual Medicaid cost settlement efforts for state health Medicaid agencies, while serving as a primary client contact on these engagements. S/he must produce quality work, meet client goals and expectations, and develop solutions to client problems in a timely manner. Must be able to draw sound conclusions based on data analysis and communicate findings effectively, both in person and in writing. PCG is a fast paced, energetic environment with dedicated professionals who are passionate and committed to the core values of the organization. Successful candidates must be willing to operate in both a team situation and autonomously with minimal supervision. They must possess strong skills in the areas of interpersonal communication, analysis, critical thinking, attention to detail, multi-tasking, and oral and written communication. This Apprentice Business Analyst will work on the Health Care Financial Services team, supporting projects in health care-related financial analysis and application development providing productized and analytical solutions for state Medicaid agencies, public and private health care providers, and state health agencies. Facilitate statewide Medicaid initiatives in a team environment Gathering and analyzing various types of data; Defining, documenting, and improving business processes; Conducting policy and other research; Conducting financial analysis for various clients Medicaid/Medicare cost reports, and/or revenue projections; Providing project management support to colleagues, Consultants, and Managers; Preparing and presenting written/verbal status reports for clients; Coordinating project requirements and client expectations; Preparing, managing, and documenting daily correspondence, written, verbal and e-mail, to clients and their stakeholders; Participating on proposal development teams, including writing sections, coordinating efforts and preparing proposal submissions; and Other responsibilities, as necessary. Other Requirements: Ability to work on-site daily in the Phoenix office; and Ability to work overtime; and Ability to travel to client sites (up to approximately 30%). Essential Qualities: Strong analytical, interpersonal, organizational, research, presentation, time management, problem-solving, and oral and written communication skills; Intellectual curiosity, enthusiasm, and eagerness to learn; Ability to take initiative, and move daily work forward; Detail-oriented, problem solving approach to business issues; Ability to follow, critically evaluate, and improve upon current processes; Good judgment in prioritizing and completing tasks, and in seeking guidance, when needed; Commitment to exceptional client service and contribute in a team environment; Dedication to accomplishing goals and challenges presented by clients and management, and accountable for results; Ability to interact with various levels of management and with clients; and Ability to see the big picture while working at the detailed level to move projects forward within specific timeline and budget. Mandatory Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree; High Proficiency in Microsoft applications, in particular Tableau, Access, and Excel. Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with Medicare and/or Medicaid policies and procedures; Knowledge of Medicare/Medicaid cost report templates; Prior experience working with health insurers, hospitals, or state health agencies; Core interest in health care, government, or public consulting; General knowledge or experience in business administration, state and local government, health insurance payment systems (particularly Medicaid); LI-HM1
