STATE EMPLOYEES: Current Office of General Services employee with permanent, contingent- permanent, or 55 b/c service as a Business Systems Analyst 1 and interested in reassignment; OR current New York State employee with one year or more permanent, contingent-permanent or 55b/c service as a Business Systems Analyst 1 OR current New York State employee with one year or more of permanent, contingent-permanent or 55b/c service in a position allocated to a Grade 11 or above and eligible for transfer under Section 52.6 or 70.1 or 70.4 of the Civil Service Law. Applicants eligible via 70.1 transfer may also be required to meet the additional qualifications below. A comprehensive list of titles approved for transfer to Business Systems Analyst 1 is available in the Division of Human Resources Management or through Civil Service GOT-IT available at www.cs.ny.gov. Bachelor's degree or higher and two years of business analysis experience where your primary duty was performing three of the five following activities: ? Using business analysis techniques to elicit requirements as the foundation for the solution to the organizations business needs (e.g., workshops, focus groups, interviews, observation, brainstorming, surveys/questionnaires, JAD Sessions). ? Using business analysis techniques for the purpose of identifying solutions aimed at improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the system, business process, or product/service to fulfill the business requirements (e.g., Data Flow Diagram, Business Process Model, Root Cause Analysis, Fish Bone Diagram, Context Diagram, Business Process Flows, or Fit-Gap Analysis). ? Describing in a comprehensive written document what the system, process, or product service must do in order to satisfy the established business requirement; this includes creating, updating, and maintaining documentation through the system development life cycle (e.g., Business Case, Use Case, Business Requirements Document [BRD], Fit-Gap Analysis, Impact and feasibility Analysis, Change Management Analysis). ? Validating requirements throughout the product/system development life cycle (SDLC) including all changes to the processes that would enable an organization to achieve its goals. ? Verifying requirements throughout the product/system development life cycle (SDLC) to ensure they perform to the required specifications and are capable of achieving the design capabilities; this includes developing test plans/scenarios and logical designs, testing the scenarios, reviewing test results, identifying constraints and risks, and/or communicating with stakeholders. NOTE: Employees with current standing on the PATT eligible list will be canvassed and do not need to apply. This announcement is to notify individuals of a transfer opportunity only. GENERAL PUBLIC Individuals with current standing on the Professional Career Opportunity (PCO) eligible list with the score of 100 or above are encouraged to apply. 55B/C ELIGIBLE CANDIDATES ONLY: Candidates who are currently 55b/c eligible and have a Bachelor's degree. If interested in this position and applying as a 55b/c candidate, please provide a copy of your current 55b/c eligibility letter. If this is not provided with your resume, you will not be considered for this position. Duties Description The Business Systems Analyst 1 position will work on the multiple system solutions being utilized within the Finance and Human Resource divisions. Under the guidance of the Business Systems Analyst 2, the incumbent of this position will work closely with program staff and other stakeholders to define and develop requirements for new or existing information technology systems and business processes and apply specialized knowledge, skills, tools and techniques to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business systems. They may also be assigned to perform enterprise analysis, business intelligence, workflow guidance, document retention and portfolio and IT Governance activities, promote business analysis organizational maturity; and develop, communicate and maintain methodology and standards to promote a consistent approach to business analysis across the enterprise. This position will reside in the Project Management Team where overview, analysis and deliverables can be managed on a project by project basis for BSC initiatives. The position will also serve as a liaison to ITS staff regarding system requirements and other technical needs. To date, the BSC provides end-to-end transactional HR services to 49 agencies and Finance services to 62 agencies. The BSC strives to ensure that we are fully engaging all systems to their full capacity and avoiding any waste by multiple systems with the same capacity. The BSC needs to ensure that we are performing all transactions on behalf of the state in the leanest and most efficient manner and that when necessary can identify and fully advocate for the necessary system enhancements. This position will be responsible for assisting the Business Systems Analyst 2 in providing expertise on business and technical areas to technical staff, especially as it relates to business process documentation and analysis, business process re-engineering, and issue identification and resolution. The position will also assist in supporting the implementation of project change management activities and the delivery of training and communications, including developing training and agency transition plans and providing support and coaching to users throughout the transition process. Additional Comments Successful completion of the two year traineeship leads to appointment as a Business Systems Analyst 1, SG-18.

Job Description Thomson Reuters combines industry expertise with innovative technology to deliver critical information to leading decision makers in the financial, legal, tax and accounting and media markets, powered by the world’s most trusted news organization. Legal Tracker (formerly Serengeti) is a SaaS solution that helps our clients’ corporate legal department perform better. Legal Tracker is the most widely used spend and matter management solution in the corporate legal department market. This position is an opportunity to work in a fast-paced, exciting, and growth-oriented business within Thomson Reuters. Job Description The BI Analyst role will work cross functionally within the Legal Tracker Client Relations Group (CRG) to identify, create, report, and analyze strategic business data. The role will focus on optimizing business performance from problem identification to building actionable data insights and solutions. This role will also work directly with customers to negotiate high-value renewals. The ideal candidate is a problem solver with experience in building business intelligence solutions who can manage multiple time-sensitive projects with minimal direction and is motivated by customer success. Responsibilities: Capture, report and provide analysis on key business data Provide strategic insight on business and customer operations Work with cross-functional teams to drive simplification in deployed technologies Work with customers in negotiation of strategic client renewals Understand customer success trends and drive adoption of market leading customer-success initiatives Handle and identify priorities for multiple projects at the same time Assist in the growth of Legal Tracker and Thomson Reuters’ product and services business Qualifications Data visualization & reporting software experience (Power BI/Tableau/Etc.) Demonstrated experience delivering actionable insights from large and complex data sets Ability to understand and translate business and product questions into analytics projects Experience working directly with customers in a B2B environment Familiarity and comfort with technology and databases to develop an expert level understanding of the Legal Tracker product and the corporate legal department customer segment Project management skills, aptitude or experience Ability to manage multiple projects of varying complexity, scale and priority simultaneously Education: Bachelor’s degree required Advanced degree preferred At Thomson Reuters, we believe what we do matters. We are passionate about our work, inspired by the impact it has on our business and our customers. As a team, we believe in winning as one - collaborating to reach shared goals, and developing through challenging and meaningful experiences. With more than 45,000 employees in more than 100 countries, we work flexibly across boundaries and realize innovations that help shape industries around the world. Making this happen is a dynamic, evolving process, and we count on each employee to be a catalyst in driving our performance - and their own. As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace. Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us. To learn more about what we offer, please visit thomsonreuters.com/careers. More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com. Job Description: Develop/Maintain/Enhance revenue models to recognize and forecast Revenue (under ASC 606)based on Near-term and Lifetime Values (“NTV” and “LTV”) of acquired and potential customers. Update monthly forecasts and assist in the preparation of variance explanations and partner with Product General Managers to lead monthly variance review discussions. Support long range strategic and financial planning process, including development of the yearly financial plan. Design and develop reports/dashboards using Data Visualization tools (Tableau), conduct trend analysis and present the recommendations to business partners. Conduct quantitative and qualitative analytical work to analyze trends, unlock insights and drive sound decision making on key issues through clear, concise recommendations. Support CFO, investor relations and other business leaders with important ad-hoc requests. Assist on acquisition/investment/partnership opportunities as part of broader corporate strategy development and execution. Drive continual process improvement leveraging best practices, standardization, and automation to scale the business. Job Description The Workforce Analytics Analyst is be responsible for consulting with internal constituents on the identification, development and reporting of human capital and related business metrics and analyses to be used in assessing and improving HR programs, HR service delivery, and business performance. The role focuses on HR analytics and data reporting capabilities by assisting with the detailed statistical analysis of people data to identify actionable insights and build predictive models. The Workforce Analytics Analyst leverages data analysis results to promote a culture of accountability; oversees the development, implementation and monitoring of programs across all of human resources through the establishment of statistical models, HR Scorecards; supports workforce planning data analytics to advance evidence-based decision making with the Human Resources team. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Preferred Qualifications Principal Responsibilities Creates reports designed to interpret Human Resources metrics including, but not limited to, data relating to turnover, compensation, productivity, headcount, performance management, talent development, affirmative action, diversity, leave of absence, compliance, labor relations and leadership. Serves as a workforce analytics liaison with HR Operations, Total Rewards and Learning and Talent Development. Applies understanding of the business and HR to evaluate information needs and recommend and develop appropriate solutions (metrics, analyses, data collection, tool functionality, etc.) to inform service delivery. Helps clients learn to access basic data directly through appropriate tools. Provides basic reports (e.g. rosters, counts, listings) as needed by clients who do not have direct access to employee data. Builds expertise in sophisticated statistical analyses (e.g. regression analysis, factor analysis, predictive modeling) and applies analytical techniques to draw inferences and conclusions from analyses (e.g. hypothesis testing). Presents methodology and conclusions of analyses directly to client and/or senior executive teams. Develops and maintains HR Scorecards with standard reporting on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis. Partners with HR leadership and other department heads to inventory and set key measures for all functional areas of HR. Develops, maintains and distributes Turnover Dashboards & Executive Summary reporting. Anticipates and develops ad-hoc reporting to meet changing business needs. Supports the HR leadership team to identify business challenges and uses data analysis to help influence changes to operations, processes and programs across the organization. Collaborates with Executive Management and HR leadership to identify the performance metrics of general HR activities and programs that drive business outcomes. Develops metrics that will track, measure and communicate key performance metrics associated with Company-wide initiatives to facilitate accountability. Manages the HR Priority Division process. Presents and interprets various analyses related to the impact of improvement opportunities. Supports reporting and tracking of assigned major initiatives for the HR organization. Acts as liaison between HR and Financial Analysis and Planning during month-end and provides quarterly reporting to facilitate the communication of summary and detailed variance commentary related to business and/or major initiative results. Creates and runs moderate to complex queries and data requests to support strategic business initiatives. Effectively reviews reports created either individually or by others. Summarizes information and effectively communicates analyses in writing and verbally to his/her audience. Performs other job-related duties as assigned or apparent. The statements used herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by an employee in this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required by an incumbent so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company. Qualifications Minimum of 1 year of HR analytics/reporting experience (required). Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Business or other discipline with extensive quantitative coursework. Minimum of 3 years of working with analytics and/or business intelligence. Proven ability to integrate and synthesize research information from multiple sources, delivering value-added insights and recommended actions. PC software knowledge and skills, including Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Crystal reports, and R. Rewarding Compensation and Benefits Eligible employees can elect to participate in: Comprehensive medical benefits coverage, dental plans and vision coverage. Health care and dependent care spending accounts. Short- and long-term disability. Life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment insurance. Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP). Employee discount programs. 401(k) plan with a generous company match. Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP). Republic Services is an equal opportunity employer. WHO WE ARE: Freedom Financial Network is a family of companies that takes a people-first approach to financial services, using technology to empower consumers to overcome debt and create a brighter financial future. The company was founded in 2002 by Brad Stroh and Andrew Housser on the belief that by staying committed to helping people, you can ensure better financial outcomes for both the customer and the business. This Heart/$ philosophy still guides the vision of our growing company, which has helped millions of people find solutions for their financial needs. What began with 2 people in a spare bedroom has now rapidly expanded to a vibrant business that employs over 2000 employees (known internally as The Freedom Family) in two locations: San Mateo, CA and Tempe, AZ. When you visit either of our offices, you’ll understand why our employees have voted us the Best Place to Work for the last several years. It’s a place where the Heart/$ philosophy continues to thrive, where we believe that success is only achieved by doing what’s right for our customers, our employees, and our communities. THE OPPORTUNITY: As the Director of Business Intelligence, you will be a key business partner to our executive leadership team. This position is responsible for Freedom Financial Network’s BI and analytics functions across the Freedom Financial Asset Management business and our Sales organization. You will lead a group of analysts to develop reporting and to generate insights that will drive the business forward. You will help to develop and scale best practices that will directly impact how we manage the operations of our lending division and sales teams, how we measure the health of our portfolio of loans, how we report information externally to our investors and to the capital markets, and how we make capital allocation decisions. This position will report to the VP of Strategy and Innovation and will work closely with the VP of Sales, the VP of Loan Operations, the Treasurer, and our partners in Data Engineering. You will join a team that has been recognized as changing the future of our company by enabling better reporting and decision-making based on data. THE ROLE: Assume the role of analytical thought leader and reporting manager for Freedom Financial Asset Management (”FFAM”). FFAM represents a rapidly growing personal loan portfolio, with over 300 sales, underwriting, and customer service personnel in support of the product. Develop, implement, and optimize analytical processes and associated KPI’s to improve how we measure and report on the performance of our lending operations, our loan portfolio and our sales organization. Partner with product, business and finance team leaders to derive business insights from data and translate those insights into actionable business recommendations and portfolio allocation strategies. Develop and manage external reporting solutions for loan and capital markets investors on loan performance, portfolio health metrics and compliance with credit facilities. Support annual budgeting, strategic planning and other business processes. Work with engineering and product senior management to understand and prioritize data and information requirements. Design and coordinate a curriculum for training in our BI tools to drive adoption and to enhance business decision-making capability. REQUIREMENTS/CHARACTERISTICS: Bachelor’s Degree required (MBA/Advanced Degree Preferred) Proven track record of leading business critical BI/Analytics practices 10+ years in BI or analytics related field preferred with Financial Services experience required Experience as a key business partner to executive leaders Experience with portfolio management and related reporting Strategic thinking and independent initiative to constructively challenge and impact a decision making process Ability to operate with cross-functional teams Strong project management and leadership skills to develop and execute complex initiatives Expertise with SQL, Excel Experience leveraging BI platforms like Tableau to develop dashboards and reporting WHY JOIN THE FREEDOM FAMILY? Fast, continued growth – there’s a lot of opportunity for advancement Voted a Best Place to Work multiple times by our employees, most recently 1 in Phoenix! Competitive compensation and benefits package! Leadership opportunities – manage a team of your own! Benefits start within 30 days 401k with employer match 3 weeks’ paid vacation (increased with tenure) 9 paid holidays & 5 sick days Paid time off for volunteer work and on your birthday This is your opportunity to be part of a growing company where dedicated professionals strive to help customers and each other succeed every day. If that sounds exciting to you, we want to talk to you. Apply today! Attention Agencies & Search Firms: We do not accept unsolicited candidate resumes or profiles. Please do not reach out to anyone within Freedom Financial Network (FFN) to market your services or candidates. All inquiries should be directed to Talent Acquisition only. We reserve the right to hire any candidates sent unsolicited and will not pay any fees without a contract signed by FFN’s Talent Acquisition leader. Thank you for your consideration.

MOBE At MOBE, we help individuals get back to living more of the life they want to live, through our Guided Self-Management Program. Studies have shown that self-management can provide real relief from chronic pain, discomfort associated with chronic illness, anxiety and stress. Self-management also plays a pivotal role in helping the body respond to treatments for chronic illness or conditions. The ideas behind self-management may be simple, but living them isn't always easy. Especially when trying to manage the everyday realities of joint inflammation, stomach issues, lack of sleep, seizure disorders and any other number of health or pain related issues. With MOBE, instead of going it alone, participants work with a MOBE Guide who provides the added support of an experienced care guide.Someone who takes the time to understand each participant?s unique health situation, guiding them through the steps of self-management. Job Summary The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst role at MOBE is responsible for building robust dashboards that monitor key trends, program activity, costs, and operational performance. The Senior BI Analyst must work closely with functional owners to develop a deep understanding of their needs and design, build, and deliver reports/analyses that meet those needs. This role will work with data from a variety of sources including medical and pharmacy claims and operational data collected throughout the MOBE program. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain a robust reporting platform for internal stakeholders including Provider Engagement and Inbound/Outbound Consumer Engagement groups Design, build, and deliver requested reports, BI dashboards, and analyses Manage multiple competing priorities and work with internal stakeholders to continuously prioritize requests Continually improve project delivery timelines, accuracy, and workflows Develop a deep understanding of functional areas and anticipate BI/reporting needs Work closely with other BI analysts, providing feedback on deliverables and guidance as needed Collaborate with Data Architect to design and implement new databases, data structures, and data processes to support Reporting and Analytics needs Work with Data Architect and IT Operations to troubleshoot issues relating to Reporting and Analytics

Business Analyst Palo alto, CA Description: The MDM/Governance team within Information Innovation Center(IIC) is looking for an experienced, customer-oriented, business- focused, and analytically-driven Business Analyst for Information Governance. Our MDM/Governance team is located in Palo Alto with team members also in Bangalore (India) and Costa Rica. The Lead Business Analyst - Information Governance will interface with executives, middle managers, individual contributors and team members across the globe. This role is based in San Jose, Costa Rica and will report to the Sr. Director of Master Data Management and Information Governance in Palo Alto, California. Primary Responsibilities: The role will be responsible for supporting global stakeholder departments and working with teammates in Information Innovation Center and MDM IT spread across different GEO’s such as Americas, EMEA, and Asia Pacific. Because the position requires interaction with geographically-disbursed teams, the Lead Business Analyst must be a self-starter with strong self-leadership, project / program management, and analytical skills and comfortable working with distributed teams without direct management oversight. He/she must be able to drive major programs and team members in collaboration with the Master Data Management and Governance leadership team on behalf of the stakeholder community. These accountabilities will be achieved through developing high trust relationships with internal and external customers, critical data analysis, attention to detail and a customer focus. Process development and optimization, as well as deliverables management will be a focus for the role. This person must be able to lead others through influence, without direct reporting authority. Essential Functions (Tasks and Responsibilities): Lead Reference Data Management program with stakeholders from Information Governance community to develop Reference data code sets Work with IT to architect Reference master data hub that serves as a single source of truth for Reference data across VMware Lead Collibra enhancements road map to deliver incremental Collibra capabilities to manage Business metadata and data lineage Drive the usability and user experience of Collibra platform to accelerate user adoption and usage Design, manage and maintain meta model for Business metadata to describe Information assets, their ownership and lineage, and data quality expectations from consuming stakeholders Collaborate with global team members in IIC and IT to drive and deliver Governance team deliverables and capabilities as well as to drive continuous improvement Drive excellence and ensure continuous improvement in quality of deliverables; specifically, Business Requirements Documents, Business Processes, Governance Requirements, and User Acceptance Test Cases and Scenarios Help to drive improvement of business domain expertise in a) team knowledge of business stakeholder departments, and b) Information Governance as well as master data management (product and company, etc.) Define methods to measure and monitor policy adherence and data quality related to governance standards Coordinate with regional business partners to maintain business alignment (data as an enabler). Work with stakeholders, IT and the MDM team on Tier 1 projects to identify, define and gather approvals for governance needs Manage relationships with data steward resources within other teams to ensure: Governance related requests and deliverables are completed and provided in alignment with the plan Support and enforcement of data governance policies, standards and processes. Clear understanding of organizational requirements that are then managed in concert with MDM IT. MDM / Data Governance Experience and Expertise 5+ years of experience and expertise in Data / Information Governance, Data Quality best practices and related tools. Experience with Collibra strongly desired. Extensive experience with Reference Data Management and working with Reference data hubs Extensive experience with building business glossary, training individuals on policy provisions and implications, and policy implementation. 5+ years of experience in Change management, user training and adoption 5+ years of experience with industry-standard MDM and Data Governance platforms. Strong preference for SAP. 5 – 7 years’ experience in Business Analysis, Requirements Development, and solutions implementation, preferably in Master Data Management Knowledge of and experience with enterprise source systems and of systems that consume master & reference data, including CRM, ERP and Data Warehouse / Business Intelligence. Strong understanding of enterprise integration. Business Acumen Solid understanding of Software Business Sales Cycles, Marketing, Sales Models, Sales Tools, Customer Service & Support, Renewals, Channels and Alliances, Finance: FP&A;, Revenue Recognition & Accounting, Tax, New Product Introductions and Digital Supply Chain, end-to-end business processes (front-office and back-office), lifecycles of various enterprise entities (e.g., Customer, Product, Install base, Service Contracts etc.) Implementation of MDM and Information Governance capabilities to enable and support success of these business functions Ability to make logical connections between business processes, MDM capabilities and data quality standards Best regards, Raju 510.795.4800 X 159

Job Title Business Analyst BI Job Description Summary Understanding our business - Demonstrate familiarity with all facets of the company’s business and exhibit understanding of services provided and customers served throughout the network Solutioning - Document requirements and assist in analyzing and reviewing potential solutions Project Delivery - Contribute as an active and positive member on project teams to deliver or exceed project outcomes Improvement & Innovation - Constantly look for ways to improve the way we work and the solutions we offer to our business and our clients Data Empowerment- Work with key business stakeholders to understand process and determine how empower users with data Conduct Workshop- Periodically conduct workshops related process improvement, User Acceptance Testing and training sessions Job Description DETAILED ACCOUNTABILITIES Work with various levels of the organization to capture project goals, objectives, and the associated requirements. Work with business key stakeholders to determine various KPIs and data reporting needs for various levels Gather requirements for building external and internal data dashboards. Minimum 7 years of functional/technical experience with various business intelligence tools and data dashboards Past work experience working with development team at various levels. Working with onshore/offshore model is preferred Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, and methodology development Proven problem resolution and analytical skills with keen attention to detail Ability to multi-task, effectively prioritize and adapt quickly to change in high pressure situations with minimal supervision required Excellent customer service skills with a demonstrated record of exceeding customer expectations Solid business acumen; ability to understand and anticipate business needs to provide appropriate solutions Strong team player with excellent listening, interpersonal, facilitation, written, oral and communication skills; ability to effectively communicate concepts in both technical and user-friendly language to management, peers, staff, and other employees so that issues and solutions are understood. Ability to work with external vendors to resolve issues and manage project initiatives Strong technical, problem resolution and analytical skills; able to multi task and prioritize effectively Experience working with cross-functional, dispersed teams Strong SQL skills with the ability to write complex SQL statements to analyze data and create prototypes. Demonstrated Business Analyst work with large scale applications that may include CRM and ERP solution is preferred Experience with Hadoop data structures and familiarity with several software delivery methodologies preferred Advanced experience with Microsoft Power BI or any other equivalent BI tool Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

Description: The Senior IT Business Analyst for Human Resources is responsible for optimizing and automating key HR business processes and systems integration. They will work within the Human Resource segment to gather business requirements, design solutions, data mine and create comprehensive analytics to support the Human Capital requirements for the organization. Position will lead the strategy of how we can best utilize the capabilities of our systems across basic HCM, Payroll, Absence Management, Advanced Compensation, Performance Management and organizational design. The leader in this position will work collaboratively within the HR team to ensure adequate definition of needs, solution designs and flawless deployments. Primary Responsibilities: Support and configuration of HCM package, business analysis and reporting using Business Intelligence features. Provide support for workforce management, compensation, absence management, advanced comp and performance management. Configure, test, and deploy HR business analytics processes Prepare ad-hoc queries using ADP / BI reporting features and calculations Develop system solutions and requested enhancements Identify system issues, conduct analyses and form conclusions Assist the business with the strategy of implementing and integrating new software to our business processes Develop security protocols and provide user access to various HR reporting outputs Support analytics configuration and integration of other HR applications in the areas of workforce planning, compensation, employee engagement, staffing and learning management Candidate must possess experience across the software development lifecycle: including identifying business requirements, designing and implementing technical solutions, integration with and installation of vendor solutions. Monitors effectiveness of current business practices and identifies areas for improvement/innovation. Has exceptional skills and expertise of business processes, and IT systems. Is an expert on business unit operations and business need for IT / Analytics solutions Deep functional knowledge of HRIS systems, Data Warehouse and various system components. Proven ability to manage successfully complex, cross-functional and global projects with a Passion for People and Technology Software Experience: SQL Server, SSIS, BIDS, Cognos reporting, Oracle, Brio, Cold Fusion, HTML, App Development, Java Script, Visual Basic, VBA (MSAccess, Excel Macros), Crystal Reports, EssBase. SPSS, MS Office Education Qualifications and Certifications: Bachelor's degree in Information Systems Technology or comparable area of study Minimum 5 years related experience required. Must possess excellent communication skills (written/verbal), along with an ability to work independently and/or in a team environment. Must be organized, flexible and able to handle multiple tasks and projects at a time. Must be able to prioritize multiple tasks effectively.

35F Intelligence Analyst Job ID : 976421 Job Views : 96 Location: AUSTIN, Texas, United States ZIP Code: 78731 Job Category: Signal and Military Intelligence Posted: 08.02.2018 Age Requirements: Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 Job Description As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of intelligence gathered from or about the enemy. Intelligence Analysts provide Army personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action. Your training may enable you to supervise, coordinate, and participate in the analysis, processing, and distribution of strategic and tactical intelligence. Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparation of all- source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and the preparation and maintenance of graphics. By joining the Army National Guard, you will be preparing yourself for a rewarding civilian career. The skills you learn as an Intelligence Analyst will help prepare you for a future with Federal Government agencies, such as the Central Intelligence Agency or the National Security Agency. The training you receive in collecting, recording, analyzing and distributing tactical and technical intelligence information will prepare you for other fields, such as research or business planning. Earn while you learn Get paid to learn! In the Army National Guard, you will learn valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance. Job training for an Intelligence Analyst requires 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and part in the field. Requires military enlistment. Applicants must meet minimum qualifications. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability. Benefits subject to change. Benefits/Requirements Benefits Paid training A monthly paycheck Montgomery GI Bill Retirement benefits for part-time service Low-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage) 401(k)-type savings plan Student Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans) Healthcare Benefits Available Requirements High School Diploma or GED Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standards Must meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details) Most non-prior service candidates will earn between $196.26 and $254.91 per drill weekend. Programs and benefits are subject to change. This position may qualify for a bonus, ask your National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information.

At Abbott, we're committed to helping people live their best possible life through the power of health. For more than 125 years, we've brought new products and technologies to the world - in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals - that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 99,000 of us are working to help people live not just longer, but better, in the more than 150 countries we serve. As a Business Analyst, you will provide high quality support for Abbott Workday Human Resource environment, specifically the Recruiting sector. You will interact with our customers to help resolve customer issues with Corporate HR systems and processes. You're a great match if you enjoy delivering excellence, possess fantastic trouble-shooting skills and enjoy a challenge. Key Responsibilities : Collect and analyze business requirements and design, implement and customize business system and standard operating procedures accordingly. Design, develop and implement business intelligence solutions and computer systems to meet business requirements within time and cost constraints. Configure and validate HRIS applications in SaaS Workday Cloud solution using functional system configurations, business process configurations and Enterprise Interface Builder web service tool. Facilitate review sessions with functional owners, subject matter experts and end users. Configure and perform performance tuning, optimization and testing of business processes and building reports. Develop plans for system operations and technical procedures for cost-effectiveness and clarify program objectives using optimization analysis. Work on complex service oriented architecture design and implementation for various business operations Assist with global HR system projects. Conduct gap/root cause analysis to find gaps & recommend alternatives to streamline process flows. Document issue resolution in Incident tracking system (Remedy and Salesforce) Work closely with the project team to track issues through to resolution and resolve queries. Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures. Experience, Skills desired: Solid understanding of business processes in ERP System support experience in Workday Human Capital Management, Recruiting, HR portal including employee and manager self-service is preferred, and\or support experience with web-based and client/server applications. Solid understanding to assess and design ERP internal controls. Strong analytical and technical skills Must have excellent verbal/written communication, user interaction & interpersonal skills and work well in a team environment. Position Accountability / Scope: Business Systems Analyst will report to HRIS Cross Functional Support Lead. This position has no budget responsibility. Minimum Education: The minimum education requirement to perform these job duties is a Bachelor’s/Master’s degree or equivalent in Commerce, Business Administration, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or 1-3 years of application development and support experience.

Summary Responsible for the foundation’s overall Business Intelligence (BI) platform, ensuring a reliable, stability, performance and guiding reporting and analytics design and development across multiple projects. The Sr. BI Engineer partners across multiple efforts to develop and drive the overall design, development and operational maturity of our BI and Analytics environment. Collaborate with a community of data architects, ETL developers, Business Analysts, and BI developers to build a new Data Warehouse and Reporting environment. Be a hands-on business intelligence developer with an execution mindset and lead core software development activities as they pertain to development of BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations. Champion efforts to ensure adoption of the our platform across the foundation. Introduce repeatable reporting and analytics patterns and approaches to development and deployment standards. Provide guidance, mentorship, and technical expertise to the core report developers on projects. Core Responsibilities Collaborate with our business partner community, Business Systems Analysts, and Solution Architects to identify BI requirements and design creative solutions for governed, self-service, and application embedded reporting. Translate strategic project requirements into usable artifacts guiding to the development of a scalable semantic model with reusable Objects, and Reports. Review completed code, documentation and other deliverables to ensure that they meet specifications and requirements based on defined expectations. Responsible for processes to support the design, construction & unit testing of reports and visualizations to ensure long-term maintainability and scalability. Ensure best practices are being followed across development efforts by developing smart auditing and code review practices. Mentor other team members on technology features and roadmap and be recognized as a business intelligence thought leader. Support end users with report creation and troubleshooting. Participate in user group meetings and training to improve the overall knowledge of the primary users of the tool to ensure adoption across the organization. Gain in-depth understanding of our transactional systems and the relationship between those environments and the data warehouse. Lead our relationship with technology vendors including a regular cadence of touchpoints to provide feedback and influence product roadmaps. Regularly engage vendors on operational issues including performance management and user provisioning Lead and mentor our consulting partners on project teams Lead reporting and analytics design sessions leading up to code migration into production, ensures timely bug fixes, and provides guidance to business and technology management on process and technical issues. Work together with ETL and EDW developers and architects to develop cohesive and performant BI solutions Partner closely with our IT Service Manager to understand and translate business requirements into stories, tasks, and subtasks in support of delivering consumable value to our business partners in an Agile manner. Leadership and Culture We believe that energized people, working well together, fueled by great leadership in an inclusive environment in which they thrive, will do phenomenal things. Core Knowledge and Skills Minimum 7+ Years of hands-on development, architecture, and analyst experience to support design of Enterprise Business Intelligence solutions (e.g. PowerBI or Tableau). 7+ Years of passionate experience in developing Dashboards, Governed Reports, Embedded-Analytics, Visualizations etc. Excellent experience in full data warehouse implementation and knowledge of developing semantic models for highly performant standard reports and visualization. Hands on experience with modeling, development of Metrics, Attributes, Filters, Hierarchies, and other reporting objects. Full lifecycle perspective (requirements gathering through production deployment and support) in aspects of Business Intelligence solutions using platforms such as PowerBI and Tableau. Proficient with SQL, Complex SQL Tuning, Stored Procedures, and other techniques to develop highly performant cubes and other means of assessing data. Hands on experience architecting and developing in a modern, cloud-based BI environment. Highly experienced understanding of Business Intelligence Frameworks. Ability to work with Enterprise Architects and Data Architects to develop BI roadmap, repeatable development and deployment frameworks etc. Thorough business skills, including stakeholder management, preparing and delivering presentations and workshops, and collecting and challenging requirements. Ability to mentor junior developers and consultants on the team. Proficient with working in a highly Agile (SCRUM) environment. Ability to advise senior IT management on BI & Analytics trends Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or another related field, with 7+ years of hands-on development of Business Intelligence solutions. This position serves as a Business Systems Analyst within the DFPS Information Resource Management Organization (IT). Under the direction of the Quality Management Services (QMS) Director, this position supports tasks related to quality management, business process management, key performance measure definition and reporting and strategic planning. Specific tasks may include (but are not limited to): defining business processes, defining key performance indicator metrics, architecting and implementing technical solutions to collect and report on key performance indicator metrics , providing training on the department’s Quality program, and managing change management activities. This position will primarily focus on systems and technology planning including software data modeling for business intelligence and reporting, software workflow and work process modeling, business process engineering, and supporting strategic planning and change management initiatives. This position works under limited supervision of the QMS Director, with general latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. This position is classified as a full-time position (40 hours a week). Work outside of regular business hours may be required. Travel to other work locations may be required. Performs special projects and other duties as assigned. Essential Job Functions: • Assist management with business, functional, technical and operational requirements elicitation for system owners. • Develop requirements documentation including models, use cases, business process maps, and specifications and provide technical clarification to both business and technical staff. • Evaluate compatibility and interoperability of commercial off-the-shelf or in-house technology systems. • Define, collect, and translate both functional and technical requirements into draft business process diagrams, workflow models, use cases, UML diagrams and similar documentation for software development. • Develop and finalize model workflows in Microsoft Office® applications like Visio, SmartDraw®, and/or similar tools. • Research, analyze, and recommend the technical direction for the IRM’s Quality Management System including but not limited to: completing needs analyses, requirements gathering and analysis, solution modeling, solution evaluation, solution acquisition or development, solution testing, solution integration, and solution maintenance. • Identify, research, and score workflow management and business intelligence tools for use within the QMS team including review and analyzing the effectiveness and efficiency of current tools. • Conduct research on software and hardware products and technology services to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts. • Compose and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential risk areas across the organization. • Develop Intranet sites using website development software as well as SharePoint 2010, 2013, and/or SharePoint 2016. • Collect requirements for building SharePoint site(s) and manages related layouts, structure and content requirements through implementation and ongoing maintenance. • Document and manage SharePoint architecture, workflow configuration, permissions, and security for sites and sub-sites. • Develop and deploys custom developed and third-party SharePoint solution packages • Develop and configure SharePoint dashboards to illustrate and report on department performance measures. • Develop and deliver comprehensive SharePoint-based IT Quality training to staff at all levels of IRM as well as external users as needed. • Document business processes, policies and procedures as well as associated performance metrics throughout the IT organization (IRM Program). • Work with IRM leadership to design and implement the IRM program’s quality management and process improvement initiatives. • Serve as point of contact for the QMS business process improvement and strategic planning projects, while also providing subject matter expertise for the QMS initiatives and processes. • Develop project plans and project work breakdown structures for process improvement efforts. • Collect, document, and organize IT business process information into a comprehensive business process library. • Manage the collection and reporting of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across the IRM program areas to assist IRM leadership with developing and measuring performance metrics. • Benchmarks performance metrics and operational metrics against similarly sized and scoped IT organizations to assist the IT leadership with best practices for setting and measuring the IT program’s organizational success. • Participate and assist with IRM strategic planning activities including documenting goals, objectives, and performance measures for the IT strategic plan and develops appropriate methods for measuring the IT programs results against the plan. • Coordinate and conduct some staff training relating to quality management systems, business process improvement, and effective KPI creation. • Conduct routine and ad-hoc audits, assessments, and functional reviews of IT work teams to determine and document operational efficiency, issues, operational risks, and other related information. • Establish, document, and maintain a comprehensive issues and risk registry to ensure effective execution of risk management activities. • Develop and recommend business process, organizational, and/or performance measurement changes based on analysis and findings. • Conduct routine audits of processes, performance-to-target, risks, accomplishments, and areas of improvement. Knowledge Skills Abilities: • Working knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint® including familiarity with workflow modeling, document library management, version control and management, list management, view management, security management, etc. • Working knowledge of large scale-computer systems and administration of business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Cognos, Qlikview, etc.) • Working knowledge of quality management systems, the process approach to quality management, and business process design and re-engineering • Working knowledge of change management methodologies and techniques • Knowledge of time and resources databases used in an IT environment for tracking IT project resources. • Advanced skill/proficiency with productivity software including the Microsoft (MS) Office Suite; especially Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint, and Visio including integrations between these applications. • Advanced skill with written and oral communication and the ability to communicate with all levels of an organization in a variety of formats. • Advanced skill with creating and prioritizing quality improvement- focused business or technical recommendations and manage the implementation of these recommendations. • Skill analyzing and interpreting program and technical information including regulations, policies, and business rules to aid in DFPS IT program goal and priority setting; • Skill with comprehending, interpreting, and applying various project, quality, and model-based methodologies, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills to complex issues within a fast-paced, deadline-driven, information technology environment. • Ability to work independently as well as lead diverse teams through complex projects and initiatives from idea through the project and into ongoing operations. • Ability to simultaneously manage multiple assignments using project management methodology best practices. • Ability to evaluate and install technical solutions to improve business processes. • Ability to troubleshoot issues, identify root cause of issues, and permanently resolve issues. Registration or Licensure Requirements: • Proven SharePoint administrative experience including workflow development and maintenance, permissions management, and data analytics and visualization. • Proven website content development and maintenance experience. • Prefer previous experience in Federal, State, or local government in a quality management-related position. • Prefer familiarity with Six Sigma, DMAIC, and/or ITIL concepts. Initial Selection Criteria: • Graduation from an accredited four-year university or college with major coursework in quality management, public administration, information technology, business, computer information systems, management information systems, or a related field; equivalent experience and education may be substituted for one another on a year-for-year basis; • Minimum of three years of technical experience with Microsoft SharePoint workflow creation and maintenance. • Minimum three years’ experience creating, organizing, and managing content located on online internet websites; • Documented experience with Microsoft (MS) Office Suite; including project planning software (e.g., MS Excel or Project); • Documented experience with business intelligence software (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Cognos, Qlikview, etc.) • Prefer certification in at least one quality management methodology, e.g., ISO 900x, Lean Quality Management, Six Sigma, etc.; • Prefer ITIL Foundation Certification. Additional Information: • Candidates selected for interviews must bring two different writing samples relevant to the position and composed entirely by the applicant to demonstrate the candidate’s writing and analysis abilities. • Candidates selected for interviews must provide transcripts (official or unofficial) at time of interview. Note: There may be no military occupation(s) that relate to the initial selection criteria and registration or licensure requirements for this position. All active duty military, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if qualified to fill this position. For more information see the Texas State Auditor’s Military Crosswalk at http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx. Jack Link’s Protein Snacks began with treasured family recipes passed from generation to generation, transforming a small North Woods business into one of the fastest-growing meat snack manufacturers in the world. Over the years, as consumer demand for convenient, high-quality snack foods increased, so has the company’s product offerings. Today Jack Link’s is the fastest-growing meat snack manufacturer in the world, and sells more than 100 different meat snack products in more than 40 countries. The Link family principles and traditions remain the same: hard work, integrity and a commitment to earn consumer respect by delivering the best-tasting meat snacks in the world. The Master Data Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for developing, maintaining, and improving Master Data quality data reports and KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) to ensure data integrity, and data accuracy. In addition, this position performs research and analysis on master file requests and ensures compliance and changes are made in accordance with business policies and procedures. The BA will be responsible for providing a variety of project management functions including: business requirements gathering, business process documentation, training/documentation creation and other related work responsibilities as required. BA will work to ensure that business process outcomes are in harmony with an organization's strategic goals, and work collaboratively across all departments of the organization to help improve Master Data processes and accuracy. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The duties and responsibilities of this position shall consist of, but not be limited to, the following: Define, develop, champion best practices for Master Data for SAP MM and APO Responsible for updating SAP ECC material master, BOM, and recipes Evaluate business gaps and process requirements for users/functions Evaluate business application modification requests Recommend and implement business process modifications Create specifications for custom integration needs and data loads Create and maintains Master Data Governance processes, policies and procedures Manage, ensure and approve all systems requests Work with IT to review SAP configuration options and identify most appropriate solutions Identify reporting needs and proper utilization of data warehouse capabilities to turn data into business intelligence Work with IT to execute test plans Define applications security needs and work closely with IT Security to determine Master Roles within the system Work with the Master Data team to automate processes Develop training materials, work aids, and process flows Assist the MD Lead on conducting training sessions Perform other duties and responsibilities as necessary. Minimal travel may be required

Position Summary: The New York County District Attorney's Office (DANY) has an opening for a Bilingual (English/Russian) Cybercrime Intelligence Analyst in the Cybercrime Intelligence Unit of its Cybercrime and Identity Theft Bureau (CITB). CITB is committed to protecting the public by investigating and prosecuting sophisticated cybercrime and identity theft schemes, including cases involving check and credit card fraud, cyber impersonation, cyber-stalking and bullying, computer hacking, as well as money laundering and threats to financial institutions. The Cybercrime Intelligence Unit is a team within the Bureau conducting proactive investigations of cybercriminals, with the goal of protecting New York County's residents and financial infrastructure. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Assist in sensitive and complex long-term investigations into cybercrime and identity theft. Collect, organize, and research a wide range of data to develop intelligence and investigative leads on cybercriminals. Generate subpoenas, spreadsheets, charts, and other exhibits for investigative purposes. Use specialized software to examine hard drives and other seized media. Perform in-depth computer searches of investigative targets. Communicate investigative results to other team members and appropriate supervisors. Act as a liaison to prosecutors and other law enforcement agencies. Perform data entry and other administrative tasks as assigned. Qualifications: Must read, write, and speak Russian at an advanced level. Knowledge of Ukranian and Bulgarian a plus. Highly skilled in standard computer operating systems and software (Windows, Microsoft Office, Excel, Word, PowerPoint) with strong ability to learn new software. Ability to work with large amounts of information and data. Database skills a plus. Detail oriented with superior organizational, analytical, writing, and communication skills. Working knowledge of DANY and New York State court systems a plus. Previous experience working with other law enforcement and intelligence communities. Ability to work independently and in team settings. Educational Requirements: Bachelor's degree required. Commitment: A two (2) year commitment to the hiring bureau is required. The New York County District Attorney's Office is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Code 384258 App Progrmng/Anal/Devel Sr Duties & Responsibilities Harvard University Information Technology (HUIT) is a community of Information Technology professionals committed to understanding our users and devoted to making it easier for faculty, students, and staff to teach, research, learn, and work through the effective use of information technology. The Business Intelligence Developer is an entry to mid-level position in the Enterprise Student Systems group, with day-to-day responsibility for testing and maintaining the data integrity of the Data Warehouse & Operational Data Store. The Developer will work with ETL implemented with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), reports and dashboards created in Oracle Business Intelligence (OBIEE), and APIs created in Mulesoft, and create test plans that include complex SQL to validate the data. Once proficient in these areas, the Developer will be paired with Senior Engineers on projects to learn to write ETL, modify the OBIEE RPD, build OBIEE dashboards, and write SQL for views and reporting in the Operational Data Store. Duties and Responsibilities: Develop and execute quality assurance tests for ETL, OBIEE RPD, and OBIEE reports. Provide tier 1 support for reporting suite, including, but not limited to: troubleshooting and resolving production issues, documenting solutions, communicating with affected users, providing technical support during project/release go-lives. Work with Senior Engineers to develop and enhance SQL views in Operational Data Store and produce data snapshots for Institutional Reporting (IR). Take the lead in maintaining the quality of data dictionary by adding, modifying, and deleting data. Develop expertise needed in OBIEE 12c to assist users by providing recommendations and solutions for developing operational, analytic, and ad hoc reporting Work with Senior Engineers to design and implement ETL and RPD for OBIEE. Assist with general administration, special projects, and perform other related job duties as needed. Basic Qualifications BS/BA in related field (e.g., computer science, engineering, information systems, math) or equivalent experience. Current technical experience to include: 2+ years experience with relational databases 2+ years experience writing complex SQL Additional Qualifications Direct experience with reporting tools (specifically OBIEE 11g and/or 12c) and techniques strongly desired. Experience developing and executing test plans. Strong understanding of Student Lifecycle a plus. Experience with Oracle Data Integrator and OBIEE presentation layer a plus. Solid understanding and demonstrated use of iterative development (preferably Agile) desired. Must have strong interpersonal and written/verbal communication skills. Ability to work closely with product managers, business analysts, and other technical team members and our partners to clarify project scope and requirements, including providing and evaluating alternative options where appropriate. Must be self-motivated, flexible and able to work independently or in a team environment. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Ability to prioritize, take initiative and work well under pressure Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment, learn quickly and independently, and an eagerness to do so Demonstrated organizational skills, especially with the ability to manage and track a large number of details and facts and understand how each detail fit into the "big picture". Occasional off-hours work, including weekends, is required for certain releases and/or emergencies. Harvard University Information Technology is unable to provide work authorization and/or visa sponsorship. This position has a 180-day orientation and review period. Harvard offers an outstanding benefits package including: Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year. Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date. Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with full vesting after 3 years of service. Tuition Assistance Program : Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools. Transportation : Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute. Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complimentary health services. Business Intelligence Analyst Who Are We? Spring EQ was founded on a mission to help homeowners unlock the value of their home by providing visibility to it’s worth, and quick access to that equity. By surrounding ourselves with some of the brightest minds in the industry, we constantly improve the home equity loan experience for our customers. At Spring EQ, we encourage innovative ideas, embrace the latest technology and strive to simplify the processes we use to accomplish our goals. As a company, we believe positivity propels productivity and creativity, simply put – we like to have fun while working hard to get the job done! We recognize the importance of a strong company culture and foster an environment of creativity and professionalism. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do at Spring EQ. While working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, you are given the opportunity to collaborate with co-workers to make every customers interaction with Spring EQ a great one. What Are We Looking For? Spring EQ is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our rapidly growing team. This position will be an active member of the Marketing & Technology team at Spring EQ and will report directly to the SVP of Marketing and Analytics. The Business Intelligence Analyst will play a key role in the development and maintenance of the data warehouse and data marts used at Spring EQ. This position will actively design and build reports using Tableau and Excel programs, and will analyze data as needed. This critical role requires a passionate and detail-oriented individual with prior experience using Tableau and Excel programs for reporting purposes. The ideal candidate will hold Spring EQ’s values of integrity, accountability, and positivity in high regard. Position Responsibilities- Design & Build – This position will be responsible for designing and building reports using Tableau and Excel programs. This position will build and optimize data warehouse and data marts utilizing star or snowflake schemas. Collaborate – This position will collaborate with business and technology personnel to develop, maintain and enhance dashboards and data exploration views in BI software Develop & Optimize – This position will develop repeatable processes for reporting purposes, and will optimize queries for fast data retrieval to minimize processing time on large data This position will assist in the testing of reports and processes for accuracy, integrity and scalability This position will leverage basic SQL and data base knowledge to build out additional data dashboards Reporting – This position will deploy reports using Tableau Online/Tableau Server, and will manage and maintain reports on Tableau Online. This position will be responsible for conducting Q/A on reports, underlying data and data infrastructure This position will update and maintain existing reports Analyze – This position will analyze data using Excel, Tableau, and statistics packages including SPSS This position will triage and/or analyze data defects and propose solutions to rectify issues Research - This position will support market research and analysis efforts as needed and will proactively research potential data issues to ensure data quality Additional ad-hoc duties will be completed as assigned What is Important to Us? The Basics: Bachelor’s Degree Required or equivalent experience Preferred majors in Computer Science or MIS Must have prior Tableau experience Must have prior Excel experience Experience with AWS Services, such as Kinesis and Lambda is a plus Data Warehouse experience with star and snowflake schemas is a plus SQL experience preferred Alteryx experience preferred Ability to multitask, problem solve and efficiently manage time The ideal candidate will have a self-starter mentality with the ability to solve open ended business challenges The ideal candidate will enthusiastically contribution to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement Time is money – At Spring EQ we recognize the importance of working with a sense of urgency. Ideal candidates will possess the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, team oriented environment Spring EQ values personal excellence, integrity and accountability – we need candidates who demonstrate these qualities in their everyday lives

Job Ad THE ROLE : You’re a data and/or finance aficionado who loves tackling intricate problems. You love telling stories with numbers. You’re passionate about making the business more efficient and successful. If this describes you, then look no further! We are seeking a Financial Analyst to play a key support role in financial planning and decision support for G&A department leadership, finance, and executive management. The ideal candidate for this role will enjoy working in a fast-paced environment on multiple complex and critical projects and tasks. THE TEAM : The finance team is a passionate group of people that play an instrumental role in driving key business decisions. THE WORK : Financial & operational reporting – Prepare, analyze and summarize various weekly monthly and periodic reporting and analysis for use by operations, multi-unit and concept leadership, executive management and Board of Directors. Financial analysis – Prepare analyses that identify, evaluate and communicate business results, trends and outlooks. Leverage tools and systems to quickly access data and provide meaningful, concise information. Support the preparation of analysis, commentary and presentation materials for monthly business review meetings including both financial results and business initiatives. Business analysis \- Utilize business analytics to provide value-added insights for concept and finance leadership, data mining techniques to perform various business modeling and analysis. Project support and ad hoc requests – Support development and preparation of ad hoc financial and business analytics on numerous revenue and expense areas, return on investment analyses and other projects as assigned. Planning process – Support the compilation of concept-level annual plan and prepare analysis of actual results compared to budget, forecast and prior year. Highlight and understand major forecast assumptions and their effects on company/concept outlook. Perform sensitivity analyses to assess reasonable range of outcomes. Process improvement – Continuously develop tools/systems and automate processes. Evaluate current processes, identify best practices, develop plans to reach goals and implement improvements. Financial modeling – Support preparation of financial models with an integrated set of financial statements, assumptions and metrics. Analyze past results and future outcomes in conjunction with market analyses to develop recommendations for changes in model assumptions. Perform sensitivity analyses to assess reasonable range of outcomes. Job Description THE SKILLS : Required : Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related finance field 1-3 years experience in FP&A, finance, or a related area preferred Aptitude for learning a variety of financial systems and database applications such as Excel, Access, SQL, PowerPoint, data warehousing, data mining, business intelligence, and other financial systems Ability to analyze key operational and financial trends across the business. Exhibit flexibility and willingness to take on new responsibilities and assignments as they are identified and to assist with various ad hoc projects as needed. Prefer : Experience with MicroStrategy and/or Adaptive Insights
