About Us Harris Health is a nationally recognized health system comprising three teaching hospitals and an extensive network of ambulatory care centers serving the people of Harris County, Texas, since 1966. Staffed by the faculty, fellows and residents from two nationally ranked medical schools, Baylor College of Medicine and The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth), Harris Health is the first healthcare system in Houston to receive the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) designation for its network of patient-centered medical homes. Each year, Harris Health provides more than 1.8 million total outpatient visits through its more than 40 ambulatory care facilities. Additionally, Harris Health sees more than 177,000 emergency visits at its Level 1 and Level 3 trauma centers and 35,000 hospital admissions through its three hospitals: Ben Taub, LBJ and Quentin Mease. Established by voter referendum to enhance the level of charity care available in the community, Harris Health System has often received national recognition for serving those in need and for its achievements in operational excellence, such as being named to the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 Most Wired Hospitals lists by the American Hospital Association’s _Hospitals & Health Networks magazine._ Additionally, Harris Health System is pleased that each of its three hospitals — Ben Taub, Lyndon B. Johnson and Quentin Mease — achieved Pathway to Excellence™ designation by the American Nurses Credentialing Center. Job Profile JOB SUMMARY: The Business Intelligence Analyst II supports system-level analytics activities of a large integrated delivery system. Work product directly impacts information delivered to the Harris Health's Board of Trustees and Commissioners Court as well as the state of Texas and CMS. Participates in complex projects and initiatives across the system, which significantly impact business results, and require a large degree of cross-functional participation/coordination. The position supports the implementation of Finance information systems. This position works in close collaboration with IT Business Intelligence supporting many of the same or similar projects and deliverables. In concert with IT, the position and actively contributes, on the Finance side, to organizational initiatives in the development of business intelligence (BI) tools. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education/Specialized Training/Licensure: Bachelor's Degree in IT, Accounting, Finance, or related discipline preferred; or four (4) years of Business Intelligence work-related experience required in lieu of degree. Work Experience (Years and Area): Three (3) years' of experience in a Senior Business Analyst capacity. Analysis, design and development of enterprise-class software Experience with data mapping in a data warehousing environment Experience in analyzing source systems and performing data mapping between disparate databases / data sources. In addition, working experience in performing gap analysis of the production data to validate business requirements. Healthcare experience. Equipment Operated: Knowledge of EMR/Epic, Clarity, SAP Business Object tools (Business Intelligence), Oracle SQL, Allscripts EPSi Enterprise Analyst and Decision Support Suite, PeopleSoft. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Communication Skills: Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact) Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking) Writing /Composing: Correspondence / Reports Other Skills: Analytical, Design, Mathematics, Medical Terms, Research, Statistical Deployment, P.C., MS Word, MS Excel, MS Access, Project Mgmt., Prod. Support, Development Advanced Education: Bachelor's Degree Major: Bachelor's Degree in IT, Accounting, Finance, or related discipline preferred; or four (4) years of Business Intelligence work- related experience required in lieu of degree. Work Schedule: Flexible Other Requirements: Knowledge of State, Medicare/ Medicaid, and other external regulatory agencies, reimbursement regulations and methodologies. Knowledge of decision sciences, cost accounting, finance, benchmark analysis, productivity reporting and delivery of healthcare services. Demonstrated detailed understanding of data and processing of data. Knowledge of the generally accepted coding standards and technical architectures. Ability to understand clinical and operational needs from a technical and financial perspective. Ability to motivate/lead teams to produce quality materials within tight timeframes and simultaneously manage several projects. Expert at facilitating group meetings. Demonstrated organizational and time management skills. Ability to analyze, report, and develop recommendations. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, to include presentation skills to upper management. Attention to detail. Problem solving skills. Customer service skills. Proficient in all MS Office applications; demonstrated advanced functionality of Excel, Access, and SQL-based repositories. Benefits and EEOC Harris Health System benefits program is designed to provide you with more flexibility and choices in meeting your specific needs. Harris Health System benefits program allows you to protect your income in case of illness, death and disability, and to help you save for retirement. It is the policy of Harris Health System to provide equal opportunity for all applicants for employment regardless political affiliation, race, color, national origin, age, sex, religious creed or disability. Applicants may request any reasonable accommodation(s) to participate in the application process. Job Category Information Technology

The UCCC Senior Business Analyst position in the Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Cancer Center (HDFCCC) is responsible for supporting the transformation of clinical and operational processes by providing analytic insight on areas of improvement in clinical operations and analysis of data, specific to the UCSF Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Cancer Center and the University of California Cancer Consortium (UCCC). In collaboration with other Departments within UCSF, the Institute for Computational Health Sciences, and staff at the other UC Comprehensive Cancer Centers, the incumbent will be part of a systematic approach to maintaining and enhancing the quality of patient care, using evidence-based practices and critical thought to improve patient outcomes. The UCCC Senior Business Analyst has advanced technical skills, is able to manage complex and iterative projects and has the business experience to understand and communicate with non-technical users. Projects involve relationships with a variety of teams, including Physicians and frontline staff, Business Intelligence and IT, Population Health Analytics and Decision Support Services: interest in partnership across the continuum is critical. Excitement about being part of a team that will transform cancer into a manageable disease and cure it when possible is essential. Healthcare reform and systems management paradigms have driven a substantial increase in the variety and volume of data; explore this foundational, growth- oriented opportunity to implement healthcare analytics at UCSF Health and transform the way we deliver care. Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world with total assets of over $2.4 trillion (as ranked by SNL Financial, April 2016) and 140,000 colleagues in nearly 50 countries. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Job Summary: The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for analysis and developing business requirements for business- led projects. Will perform documentation of business requirements, process definition, and executive level presentations. Major Responsibilities: 70% - Analysis and creation of business requirements and project documentation. Identify the areas where changes are needed in business plans. Analyze the entire business, including data, goals, process, and organization. Identify the areas of strength and weakness and suggest areas of improvement. Monitor the impact of such changes. Document and analyze the required information and data. The analysis is accomplished by evaluating information gathered through workshops, surveys, interviews, business process description and task analysis. Work with the business area management to identify required changes. Communicate needed changes to project management team and to business line management. 30% - Process improvement and documentation including developing playbooks and desktop procedures. Establish repeatable processes and evaluate for efficiencies. Ensures issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner. Create and maintain document libraries for documentation. Support management by creating and contributing to presentations and other projects. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree preferred. Direct work experience in Financial Services industry and working in a Program Management office is preferred. Very strong technical skills coupled with business intelligence and a deep understanding of business areas needs so that they can be transformed into application or operational requirements. Must demonstrate understanding of the technical designs as well as the specifications. Must have experience with business case development and presentation, as well as negotiation and conflict management. 3+ Year’s experience with Process Improvement, Consulting, and Project Management is preferred Knowledge & Skills: This role requires experience in project management and business analysis and work experience in managing medium to complex projects and written detailed business requirements. Experience with mergers and acquisitions are recommended for this position. A key competency for this position is strong MS PowerPoint and documentation skills. The Analyst must be able to use data to create meaningful requirements and persuasive proposals. Strong communication skills are necessary for this position, as it will interface with all levels of the business including Executive Management. Critical thinking and problem solving are key skills for this role. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified .

Excellent communication and customer service skills, especially when dealing with business users. Under the general leadership of the Strategy, Architecture and Analytics director (SAA), and in conjunction with other University areas and external organizations when necessary, the Business Intelligence and Analytics Engineer is responsible for designing, developing and evolving the environment (physical and logical) for the Enterprise Data Warehouse, Data Governance, Big Data and other systems. The Business Intelligence and Analytics Engineer is also responsible for enterprise data management implementation and for developing Metadata solutions. Position Specific Responsibilities: Lead architect providing design and implementation expertise around data warehouse, data marts, business intelligence reporting, cloud solutions, big data, and the ETL sub systems. Analyze the requirements for data warehouse and data integration across University systems and develops specifications for data integration and interfaces. Writes computer code to integrate data between systems, and to manage data workflow. Provides end to end solutions and helps during design and implementation of a Enterprise Data Warehouse and associated sub systems. Evaluates third party software and design potential infrastructure solutions to meet business needs. Ability to lead Data Analysts, ETL, and BI Report developers and provide leadership during different work streams within the project. Act as technical liaison between LMU partner offices and ITS. Engineer and implement processes to maintain integrity and quality of the data residing in the data warehouse, data marts and cloud systems. Responsible for day to day support of the data warehouse, associated data marts, and ETL systems. Designs and implements production processing tools, including performance monitoring, scheduling tools, and notification systems in the event of failure. Engage and collaborate with the “Operational” team in developing standards, guidelines and best practices for the development of data integration efforts. Design, create and maintain Real Time and Nightly ETL systems. Provide industry best practices in the domain of Data Architecture, Data Warehouse design and development. Will be responsible for data warehouse and enterprise BI solutions, including the planning, designing, and testing of installs, patches, upgrades, and clones of databases running primarily on Red Hat Linux, Windows operating systems and AWS environments. Represent LMU within internal and external communities and at professional organizations or associations, serve on committees as required. Perform other duties as assigned or requested. Experience/Qualifications: Must have minimum five (5) years of experience providing production support for several Oracle relational database management systems and applications, and systems troubleshooting in progressively responsible positions. Some experience with Oracle and third-party software, including, but not limited to, Oracle 11g/12c Enterprise Edition, Oracle Client, SQLPlus, RMAN, Enterprise Manager Grid Control, exp, imp, Data Pump, and TOAD is required; AWS is a plus. Minimum two (2) years of enterprise data warehouse experience and Business intelligence tools (like Business Objects, Tableau) in progressively responsible positions. Must have minimum two (2) years of experience working with ETL tools. TALEND is preferred. Enterprise working level knowledge of working with Data Modeling (Dimensional Schemas), creating logical and physical Data Warehouse models (including implementation into Physical schemas and utilizing complex SQL and PL-SQL). Relational database experience necessary (Oracle preferred). Must be well-versed in overall Oracle database performance monitoring, troubleshooting, and tuning. Experience with SQL diagnostics and tuning techniques a plus. Exemplary communication skills (both written and oral) evidenced by background in preparing comprehensive requirements, specifications, deployment procedures, testing plans, maintenance processes and incorporating complex, highly technical information. Ability to multi-task and work as an effective member of a team. Required Education: Typically a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or related field or equivalent experience. Incumbent will be expected to continue upgrading knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to keep abreast of regulation/policy changes. License/Certification/Registration Requirements: Physical Demands (if applicable)

Data is central to Twitch’s decision-making process, and analysts are a critical component to evangelize data-driven decision making in all of our operations. As an analyst at Twitch, you will be shaping the way that business performance is measured, defining the way we transform our data, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business, leading the way for high quality, high velocity decisions throughout the company. For this role, we’re looking for an experienced analyst to join our central analytics team, which is focused on business intelligence, data governance, and empowering staff throughout Twitch to use and trust our business data. Your work will include not only defining and enhancing our aggregate layer, but also connecting into BI tools that enable users to discover and analyze the data. In the process, you will have the opportunity to interact with technical and non-technical staff members throughout the company, and your effort will have a direct impact on hundreds of stakeholders at Twitch. Responsibilities Create and maintain the logic and processes to support trustworthy and efficient consumption of Twitch’s business data in aggregate form. Deploy solutions that enable internal teams to understand, explore, and analyze Twitch’s business data. Aggressively optimize for impact by focusing on work output that scales well. Be an effective mentor for both your team and the company through your deep domain and process expertise, and your broad understanding of our data structure and stores, increasing the data literacy of stakeholders throughout Twitch. Maintain a culture of high quality output and exceptional customer service: effectively communicate at all levels, ensure that work gets done well and on time, respond to unexpected obstacles and reallocate time as necessary. Identify opportunities for developing new data sources, and provide technical leadership around making those data sources high quality and broadly available. Requirements 4+ years of experience in analytics, data engineering, or related role. Strong proficiency in SQL, ETL, and data modeling in a business environment with large-scale, complex data sets. Fluency in data analysis, including defining KPIs and communicating about data to inform the success of the business and its features. Detail-oriented with superior organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize workload and roadmaps. Comfortable giving definition to ambiguous problems. Can do this independently with limited guidance. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Perks Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance 401(k) Maternity & Parental Leave Flexible PTO Commuter Benefits Amazon Employee Discount Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.) Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Served Daily Free Snacks & Beverages Twitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Job Code 359057 Admin Dept/Program Admin Duties & Responsibilities As a member of the Business Intelligence team for External Relations (ER), the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst creates and maintains an inventory of reports and dashboards that monitor operations and increase the effectiveness and efficiency of fundraising, prospect management, and alumni engagement activities. Working with the Associate Director of External Relations Business Intelligence, this position delivers near real-time fundraising reports, produces management dashboards and enables analysis of prospect assignments, solicitations, and individual performance. You will provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems. Develops and evaluates alumni data using business intelligence tools, management information systems utilized for reporting (Advance, Enterprise database) Examines and evaluates purpose and content of alumni reports to develop new, or improve existing format, use, and control. Collaborates with staff originating, handling, processing, or receiving reports to identify problems and to gather suggestions for improvements. Recommends establishment of new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve report content, accuracy and completeness of information. Data and Knowledge Management Facilitates discussion between business side end-users and technical resources to ensure complete understanding of project needs and use cases to ensure successful product releases. Ensures that challenges, problems or potential problems with data or systems are communicated quickly and clearly to other team members. Educate staff in the use of reports, teaching them how to prepare reports and properly utilize report data. Gathers, prepares required documentation of requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations. Basic Qualifications BA/BS in computer science, mathematics, statistics, business related major such as economics, finance, or accounting. 5+ years experience including 2 years in creating BI dashboards (or equivalent) and writing SQL queries. Experience with creating visual modeling of data Experience transforming data sets into measurements of performance and quality Experience with Oracle Business Intelligence preferred. Familiarity with a customer relationship management system (i.e. Advance, Salesforce, Raiser’s Edge.) Experience with report development, including requirements gathering, design, testing, training, and implementation. Advanced Excel skills Additional Information Cover Letter is Required. POSITION PURPOSE Works closely with our business partners and development resources to design and develop Business Intelligence (BI) solutions and analytics strategies. Provides business expertise in order to help bring insight to the analytic requirements and recommendations for solving complex business needs with BI reporting tools including, but not limited to, SAP Business Objects, Tableau and other analytic platforms. Builds a consultative partnership between the business areas and the Analytics and Data Warehouse organization and serve as the primary design leader for medium-to-large complex BI Solutions. Possesses significant business domain knowledge to provide the most complex reporting solutions using statistically valid methods to structure and display results. Facilitates design reviews with developers to communicate business requirements and collaboratively build efficient queries and present data for ease of use and maintainability. May be required to resolve complex support issues that are escalated from other analysts or business customer users and serve as a mentor to lesser experienced staff. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Knows, understands, incorporates and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision and Values in leadership behaviors, practices and decisions. Leads BI requirements and development activities for new reports, dashboards, and tools including: Works with leadership to develop team member skills in the areas of data/business knowledge, reporting, querying, and analytics Provides expert data analysis and process automation knowledge to internal customers; Serves as an escalation point for issues that cannot be resolved. Leads business and technical projects, assignments, analysis and design. Creates work-plans and process flow requirements for development of new or improved business capabilities. Assists design and deliver end user training and education programs, with RHM and System Office business or process owners. Facilitates design reviews of reporting solutions developed by other members of the Data Warehouse and Analytics team. Generates complex standard or custom reports summarizing business, clinical or financial data for review by executives, managers, clients, and other stakeholders. Responsible for relationship management with key business stakeholders. Creates comprehensive test plans and test scripts. Executes and documents testing results for issues, enhancements, and new development. Reviews and signs off on testing results for the lower level BI Analysts. Leads discussions identifying areas for improvement and enhanced self-service for user tool development. Cultivates working relationships within the Data Warehouse and Analytics areas and with the business units that are positive, professional and collaborative. Interfaces with director and staff level positions. Documents business requirements for business intelligence or information technology reports, dashboards, or other outputs using graphical tools such as Visio, PowerPoint and work flow tools. Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State and local laws/regulations; the Trinity Health Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct; as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behavior. Performs other duties as assigned. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in healthcare or information technology and a minimum of five (5) to seven (7) years' experience in healthcare and/or Information Technology or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Five (5) to seven (7) years' experience in informatics reporting and analysis and knowledge of e-quality measures for organizations such as The Joint Commission, CMS and AHRQ. Proficiency in supporting business customers in related decision making and proficiency with the tools needed to support their requests. (Business Objects, Crystal, SPSS, SQL Query). Ability to learn Epic's software and Certification will be required after training is complete. Minimum of five (5) years' experience or equivalent training/education in ad- hoc reporting and analysis, including: Significant experience with ad-hoc analysis and reporting tools (SAP Business Objects, Tableau, QlikView, etc.); Experience using statistical analysis tools such as SAS, SPSS or R, is preferred Support and creation of reports, scorecards, dashboards using these tools; Data warehouse concepts and querying including the ability to understand SQL and write moderately complex SQL queries, and Ability to optimize data, taking complex sets of data and managing them via filters, calculations, and visually compelling graphical user interface. Minimum of seven (7) years' experience using source system/transactional data. Preferably in the HealthCare vertical. Ability to effectively troubleshoot reporting and data issues across the multi-tier environment such as user interface, semantic layer and database. Ability to work in a self-directed environment and clearly communicate tasks to team members and the ability to follow up and oversee other colleagues. Experience leading business and technical projects, assignments and analysis. Familiarity with standard project management methods and processes. Excellent organization, analytical, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Must possess the ability to work in teams. Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment. A personal presence which is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals and values of Trinity Health. Extensive informatics or information technology experience with responsibility in conducting analysis, research and process improvement. Excellent organization, analytical, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Ability to collaborate effectively with a variety of different users and to work with clients on defining clear specifications for reports/dashboards/others. Experience with creating reports and other data visualization needs that align with user users' requirements preferred. Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment. A personal presence which is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals and values of Trinity Health Demonstrated transaction system and reporting/statistics tool experience. PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS Operates in a typical office environment. The area is well lit, temperature- controlled and free from hazards. Incumbent communicates frequently, in person and over the telephone, with people in a number of different locations on technical issues. Manual dexterity is needed in order to operate a keyboard. Hearing is needed for extensive telephone and in person communications. Must be able to speak and communicate clearly and effectively. The environment in which the incumbent will work requires the ability to concentrate, meet deadlines, work on several projects at the same time and adapt to interruptions. Must be able to adapt to frequently changing work priorities and be able to prioritize and balance the requirements of working with the System Office and Regional Health Ministries (RHMs). Must be able to travel to various Trinity Health sites as needed. Workhours may include afterhours and weekends. May require participation in a rotating call schedule after implementations have begun.

Developer Analyst 3 Emerging I. DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES The Department of Information Resources (DIR) requires the services of one Developer Analyst, hereafter referred to as Worker(s), who meets the general qualifications of ITSAC Developer Analyst 3 Category, Emerging Technology Type and the specifications outlined in this document for the Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts (CPA). All work products resulting from the project shall be considered “works made for hire” and are the property of the CPA. CPA may include pre-selection requirements that potential Vendors (and their Workers) submit to and satisfy criminal background checks as authorized by the Texas law. CPA will pay no fees for interviews or discussions, which occur during the process of selecting a Worker(s). As a PeopleSoft/Business Intelligence Report Writer, the Worker must have a strong background in PeopleSoft 9.1 or above and have worked with BI, PeopleSoft and Data Warehouse technology. The Worker must have extensive experience in the following: developing PeopleSoft reports based on functional specifications for a group or organization working with business customers to gather requirements for report development working with business customers and IT SMEs to define BI training requirements providing training to users adhering to software development processes preparing detailed documentation generating work estimates in an SDLC environment. The Worker must be able to work with the Data Warehouse, PeopleSoft and Agency teams to ensure reports comply with the standards and all data modeling artifacts are prepared accurately in a timely fashion. The Worker must also be quality conscious and be dedicated to delivering quality products on time and on budget. Onsite Requirements: Worker will be required to work on site with the team. Working remotely will be limited and must be pre-approved by the Project Manager and Direct Supervisor II. WORKER SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Required) Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. Must be able to work independently in a diverse team environment with local and remote teams Must possess problem-solving skills and ability to multi-task with readiness to put in extra efforts when necessary Perform related work as assigned Must be able to work independently Knowledge of software development methodologies Must possess problem-solving skills and ability to multi-task Must be able to work around projects and deadlines with readiness to put in extra efforts when necessary Terms and Conditions: If selected, the vendor shall be require to sign and adhere to the CPA’s Additional T&Cs. The contractor shall be required to sign several security documents and also adhere to CPA’s Additional T&Cs Minimum Requirements: Years Skills/Experience 8 Experience in Business Intelligence Report Writing 5 Experience with PeopleSoft 9.1 or above FMS and HCM 5 Experience with Business/System/Data Analysis and Improvement 5 Experience with the development of various reporting mechanisms 5 Extensive knowledge of/experience with data integration, data quality, multi- dimensional design and ETL tools, processes and methodology 3 Extensive experience with highly complex application security requirements Preferences: Years Skills/Experience 3 Proficient with the Microsoft Windows and Office products 2 Public sector experience (Federal, State or Local Government) III. TERM OF SERVICE Work Order Term: January 2016 thru August 31, 2016. Estimated hours for FY16: 1300. This assignment may be extended based on project need and funding. IV. WORK HOURS AND LOCATION A. Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the CPA. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00AM to 5:00PM, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed. Candidate may have to work evenings or weekends in order to meet business needs and or deadlines. B. The primary work location(s) will be at 111 E. 17th Street, Austin, Texas 78774. Any and all travel, per diem, parking, and/or living expenses shall be at the Worker’s and/or Vendor’s expense. C. CPA will provide pre-approved, written authorization for travel for any services to be performed away from the primary work location(s). Pre-approved travel expenses are limited to the rates and comply with the rules prescribed by the State of Texas for travel by its classified employees, including any requirement for original receipts. D. The Worker(s) may be required to work outside the normal business hours on weekends, evenings and holidays, as requested. Payment for work over 40 hours will be at the hourly rate quoted and must be coordinated and pre-approved through CPA. RESPONSE DEADLINE for consideration and should be received by January 14, 2016 @ 5:00 PM (CT).

Job is frequently expected to recommend new solutions to problems, to improve existing methods/procedures/services and generate new ideas. May also review decisions made by other individuals on more routine matters. IMPACT OF DECISIONS: Decisions have significant impact to the facility/department or division, causing increased satisfaction or dissatisfaction; producing efficiencies or delays; promoting or inhibiting personal intellectual or professional development; and/or contributing to financial gain or expense. Errors may be serious, usually not subject to direct verification or check, causing losses such as improper cost calculations, overpayment or improper utilization of labor, materials or equipment. COMMUNICATION/INTERACTIONS: Negotiate and influence – interprets department strategies and services, resolves conflicts, influences outcomes on matters of significance for the division, conducts final negotiations and coordinates approvals/decision making below the executive level. Interactions are typically with customers and Top Management. CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIPS: Regularly assesses and diffuses complex, and escalated customer issues. Takes personal responsibility and accountability for solving systemic customer service problems. Regularly explores alternative and creative solutions to meeting the needs of the customer within HISD's policies and guidelines. WORKING/ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS: Work is normally performed in a typical interior work environment which does not subject the employee to any hazardous or unpleasant elements. Repetitive motion: Substantial movements of the wrists, hands, fingers, and/or upper body for sustained periods of time, including using extremities to drag, push, pull or grasp. Sitting: Particularly for sustained periods of time. Work is normally set to specified shifts. This position is expected to be goal and customer service focused. During times of emergencies, outages and project planned work; employees are expected to be on call and available until the event is addressed. During system conversions, extra effort may be required in order to ensure the roll out of the system is successful.

The rank of Investigator/Intelligence analyst is a specialized position within the Investigation Division. The Investigator/Intelligence analyst is responsible for developing Field Intelligence Reports and sharing this information with authorized members of the department. The Investigator/Intelligence Analyst of the Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal Police Department shall meet on a regular basis with counterparts of Local, State and Federal departments to share information. The Investigator/Intelligence Analyst shall report directly to the Investigation Lieutenant. The Investigator/Intelligence Analyst shall maintain an open line of communication with members of the Uniform Force. In addition to the Intelligence Analyst duties, the Investigator/Intelligence Analyst may be required to conduct investigations commensurate with the rank of Investigator. When the Investigator/Investigative Analyst responds to an incident, if they are the first responder of the Investigation Division, they will take over and be responsible for the scene as well as assuming responsibility for supervising the Technical aspects of the investigation. The Investigator/Intelligence Analyst shall assume all other duties as assigned by the Investigation Lieutenant or higher authority. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: Conducting follow up investigations on intelligence matters as directed by the Investigation Lieutenant. Insure that the Investigation Lieutenant is kept informed of Intelligence/Investigations assigned to the Investigation Division. Review cases under investigation with the members of the Uniform force, on a regular basis. Frequently review the training needs with the Investigation Lieutenant to insure needs of the Investigation Division are met. Review changes in the law that affect the Investigation Division with the Investigation Lieutenant to insure that all members of the department are made aware of the changes. Ensuring correct and efficient completion of intelligence gathering and/or investigative assignments including submission of timely and accurate reports. Ensuring that excellent work performed by members of the Uniform Force relating to intelligence obtained is brought to the attention of the Investigation Lieutenant. Ability to conduct extensive interviews with victims, witnesses and suspects and reduce the information to written statements Conduct investigations of burglaries, robberies and other serious crimes as directed by the Investigation Lieutenant. Prepare search warrants and other court documents. Ability to testify in court on investigations conducted. Ability to prepare case documents from notes taken during the investigation process. Requesting specialized units when needed (e.g. snow mobiles, All Terrain Vehicles, boats, personal watercraft etc.). Responding to the scene of serious incidents or major felonies and make notifications as per current Rules and Regulations. Initial crime scene management. Promoting fiscal responsibility within the Investigation Division. Perform the duties of the Detective Sergeant in the Detective Sergeants absence. Carrying out other duties not listed as directed by the Investigation Lieutenant or other higher competent authority. QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS : To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to interact with other professionals in the specialized field of Law Enforcement Intelligence and analysis. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES: Strong oral and written communication skills required in conjunction with the following: The ability to gather, analyze and disseminate critical intelligence information to members of the Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal Police department as well as other law enforcement agencies. Thorough knowledge of the principles and practices of modern police administration and police methods. Thorough knowledge of state statutes and codes, federal guidelines and protocols, and local ordinances relating to law enforcement. Knowledge of the investigative process. Experienced in the use of computers with standard office software. Ability to plan, organize, and direct the work of police officers at crime scenes when required. Assist the Investigation Lieutenant in the development of proper training and instructional procedures relating to the field of Criminal Intelligence. Accurately assess the potential consequences of alternative courses of action and select the one, which is most acceptable and appropriate. Recognize potentially dangerous situations and to act decisively to protect persons and property from harm. Prepare and present concise and meaningful oral and written material relating to the activities of the Division. Create and maintain effective working relationships with the District Attorneys and court officials as well as, Town officials, department heads, State and Federal authorities, and civic leaders. Work effectively with the public. Work under physically and emotionally stressful situations. REASONING ABILITY: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variable situations. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Must be at least 21 years of age. Have and maintain a valid driver’s license with a clean drivers abstract in accordance with the Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe’s Fleet Policy. Download the application instruction package. NATIVE PREFERENCE POLICY The Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe strives to be an equal opportunity employer dedicated to the policy of nondiscrimination based on race, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, physical disability, veteran status or any other non-job related factor. Among qualified applicants, the SRMT will give preference to the qualified native applicant. DRUG TESTING POLICY The successful applicant for employment must submit to and pass a drug test for illegal substances prior to employment being confirmed. BACKGROUND CHECK Some positions require candidate(s) to successfully pass a criminal background check prior to beginning employment, used solely for employment related purposes. ELIGIBILITY LIST A list of qualified candidates is created from interviews that may be used to appoint individuals to similar positions within the Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe for a period of six months. INTERVIEW Testing in the applicable skills may be required as part of the interview process.

This role is critical to the success of the client relationship in driving performance management, process improvement and innovation thru fact- based decision making. We are seeking candidates that are self-starters who can work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our team immediately. Description Under the supervision of the manager, the BI Analyst is responsible for supporting the organizations business intelligence needs by implementing data management, reporting and analytics solutions. The individual will participate in gathering business needs, documenting requirements, identifying data sources and data elements, developing Business Intelligence components, and delivering solutions. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Services, or related fields, or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience. 4-7 years of experience in database and programming 4-7 years of In-depth experience in (SQL) or demonstrated experience from work performed. 2-5 years of healthcare workflow, clinical process, and data flow. 2-5 years of experience with Electronic Medical Record Systems such as Epic and Cerner.

Overview Must have experience in analyzing large, complex, multidimensional datasets with data querying languages (SQL), BI tools (MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.), programming languages (Python, Java, Scala, etc.), and statistical/mathematical software (R, Weka, SAS, Matlab) Must have experience in dealing with both structured and unstructured data, and Hadoop or similar technologies to recognize patterns within data and generate insights/deliver value; familiarity with streaming analytics using tools such as Spark, Kafka, Storm, etc., and cloud services like AWS, Azure Cloud, etc. Hands-on experience delivering business intelligence and data analytics solutions that involve statistical modeling or machine learning, along with the use of associated R/Python libraries and tooling which emphasize effective design and usability for end-users Responsibilities Identify, lead, and deliver efforts to build reports, visualizations, and dashboards using BI tools and practices, with solution designs that leverage statistical approaches, machine learning, and related disciplines through the use of industry standard tools, libraries, and approaches Engage with stakeholders across the organization to align priorities, communicate solution design tradeoffs and recommendations, and build and execute development plans Design user interfaces, tool screens, and end-user workflows to maximize understandability of information, ease of use, and alignment with EXL client aesthetic and usability standards Continuously improve technical design patterns, workflows, and tools, defining and enforcing standards when necessary to sustain the platform’s effectiveness and sustainability; experiment with and promote adoption of new tools and approaches when appropriate Support end-users to ensure they have reliable access to and understanding of data they need to trust to do their jobs effectively Qualifications R/Python Certifications; Certified Business Intelligence Professional from TDWI BI and analytics coursework completed from Coursera, Udacity, Data Camp, etc. Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field 5 years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering business solutions that rely on effective availability, usability, and understandability of data and analytical workflows Must have experience in analyzing large, complex, multidimensional datasets with data querying languages (SQL), BI tools (MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.), programming languages (Python, Java, Scala, etc.), and statistical/mathematical software (R, Weka, SAS, Matlab) Must have experience in dealing with both structured and unstructured data, and Hadoop or similar technologies to recognize patterns within data and generate insights/deliver value; familiarity with streaming analytics using tools such as Spark, Kafka, Storm, etc., and cloud services like AWS, Azure Cloud, etc. Experience with machine learning, such as k-nearest neighbors, random forests, ensemble methods and their corresponding implementation packages in R (Caret, RandomForest, Rweka, etc.), and Python (SciKit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, NLTK, etc.) Ability to use best practices and principles in SQL, query design, data validation/automation, and analytic functions; understand differences between various database architectures and implementations, such as Netezza, Oracle, Postgres, Teradata, DB2, SQL server, and/or MS Access Knowledge of Geographic Information Systems (GIS), geospatial data, GIS analysis and workflow, and cartographic and graphic design principles Solid understanding of Data Warehouse concepts including patterns for time variance and generic vs. explicit data structures, standards-based approaches for object names and data types, and using logical data models to document and explain business objectives EEO Statement EEO/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabilities

FMC Corporation is a leading specialty company focused on agricultural and lithium technologies. We are proud that our products help grow the world's food, improve health and contribute to a more sustainable energy supply. FMC is a globally diverse organization that offers its employees exciting opportunities to work on challenging projects that are important to the achievement of our strategic objectives. Your education and professional experience are valued and put to use from day one. Your success at completing key initiatives can result in a varied, progressive and fulfilling career with FMC. With a corporate culture of innovation, integrity, responsibility and customer intimacy, we foster “The Right Chemistry” in everything we do. We are looking for people to join us in creating, developing, and improving our products, our processes, and our markets. If you are ready to make a difference every day, FMC is ready to talk to you. Responsibilities Responsible for preparation of financial/business performance reporting, forecasting, budgeting, financial modeling and business analysis. Conduct financial analysis and provide recommendations to support key business decisions for North America Crop business (US and Canada) including marketing programs, tech services, development, regulatory and competition. Interpret and analyze financial/business information in order to monitor performance, identify potential issues/opportunities, explain variances to Budgets, Operating Plans, and latest forecast and present financial reports to management. Responsibilities: Lead and act as the single point of contact for monthly forecasting process (P&L;, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow), including direct coordination with Sales, Marketing and Global Supply Chain. Provide deeper analysis and explanation of financial results. Qualified candidate should have the ability to: - Provide in-depth explanation of results; - Gathering and Synthesize data to identify key business drivers and - Coordinate analysis across different functions, business areas and locations. Responsible for the quarterly review deck preparation for area VPs and Directors. Assess the quality of inputs, generate insightful outputs and communicate effectively to decision makers. Lead the annual budget, working closely with segment team leaders. Conduct strategic analysis, financial modeling, valuation, and general analytical support. Model financial implications of commercial decisions. Proactively collaborate (and lead) in ad hoc projects and analysis as needed. Required Education MBA preferred, BA/BS in finance or equivalent experience. Qualifications A minimum of 8 years’ experience in financial functions with exposure to marketing, strategic planning, and product development. Demonstrated skill in applied financial analysis, forecasting, budgeting, and internal financial reporting. Financial modeling skills, including NPV, EVA Analysis and business / product valuation. Extremely strong MS Excel and PowerPoint skills Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work in a matrix organization and handle ambiguity. Strong written and oral presentation skills. Knowledge of chemical products and markets, including ability to interpret non-crop insecticide, herbicide and fungicide market data a plus. Accounting experience and knowledge of GAAP required. Knowledge and effective use of SAP modules (SD, FI and CO) and Business Intelligence required. Resourceful and proactive in seeing projects through completion; ability to support M&A; activities, including post-M&A; execution. EEO Statement FMC employees enjoy competitive compensation, a menu of work/life benefits and opportunities to continue developing their skills and building their career. FMC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability or protected veteran status. FMC supports a drug-free workplace.

Position Summary: Responsible for inspiring and energizing key business partners to act upon the knowledge and insight generated to make informed business decisions, deliver against critical business objectives, and drive innovation. Identify key (sub) category opportunities and drivers to guide brand and innovation development Identify category specific trends as well as mega-trend applications Determine key benefits and size of opportunities to energize the teams behind them The primary influence teams include Category Strategy, Product Development, R&D, Packaging and Marketing - role will work closely with them to design research and learning experiences to enable strong knowledge adoption. The Consumer Insights Analyst will fuel opportunities for the company through the application of market and consumer understanding tools to the following streams of work: Holistic Opportunity Assessment for sub-categories - Develop recommendations to enable the Aveda brand to adjust innovation plans to win in key sub-categories (haircare, skincare, make-up, etc). Determine key benefits, their importance and role for key design consumers, and key category drivers from a consumer & market standpoint to guide innovation development. Identify category specific trends as well as mega-trend applications to the category –identify beauty trends that lead to creation of new categories, new segments and better ways of serving consumers. New Territory Identification – enable the identification of consumer relevant innovation territories that translate to consumer appeal. Contribute to their integration and adoption by Corporate Innovation and brand teams. Support specific platform programs as needed. Key responsibilities include: Recommend, create and execute learning plans for the different business needs in a collaborative manner. This includes identifying research partners in the industry that fulfill the needs of non-standard research methodologies. Manage and maximize the specific proportion of the research budget and identify potential gaps as projects arise. Enable the training and education of the business teams regarding Consumer and Market Insights, both through formal/forum training as well as on-the-spot coaching. Display independence on the day-to-day, alignment of key stakeholders for each project and accountability for budget management choices. Qualifications Education: BA/BS degree in Marketing or Communications Experience: Candidate must have at least 5 years experience in a consumer insights role, preferably in a fast-paced, highly-innovative consumer business supporting innovation, brand development and strategic work. Global experience in luxury, beauty, fashion desirable. Other: Flexibility, strong work ethic, quick learner, excellent oral and written communication, strategic thinker Able to handle a heavy workload with competing priorities Proven experience in applying Market Research methodologies for Innovation and Category Strategy. Proven analytical capabilities Must be equally capable of executing both quantitative and qualitative projects. Comfortable utilizing and analyzing various business intelligence sources outside consumer related insights (syndicated data, market level data, social media/digital analytics, retailer customer data, and consumer trends). Strong ability to turn insights into action through knowledge generation and activation (not just data collection) Ability to connect the dots and identify trends, present them in an engaging way and drive action from the working teams. Solid business acumen that would enable turning insights into actionable recommendations. Ideation/moderation experience a big plus. Job: Marketing Primary Location: Americas-US-MN-Blaine Job Type: Standard Schedule: Full-time Shift: 1st (Day) Shift Travel: No We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Job Number: 185884

Accelerate Your Career _Drive global technology_ With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence. We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue. From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career. CDK Global is hiring a Lead Business Intelligence Data Analyst! The Lead Business Intelligence Data Analyst , known in CDK as the BI Analytics Managing Lead, is responsible for managing technical analytics activities related to CDK’s Digital Marketing Services Platform. The Managing Lead will oversee a team of 8-10 Business Intelligence Analysts with the primary role of building the group’s business intelligence capabilities and increasing client facing value-add outputs without reducing quality or service. The Ideal Candidate will possess: . Extensive experience directly managing a team of Data Analysts . Exceptional experience analyzing website and digital marketing performance, integrating multiple quantitative and qualitative data sources, reconciling conflicts, and distinguishing user requests from underlying true needs . The ability to define and solve problems by creatively using available data and making reasonable assumptions . Client management, and strategic and tactical consultation experience, building actionable, data-driven analytics and optimization solutions across multiple platforms and channels . Excellent communication and relationship building skills from stakeholders up to executive level . Experience guiding a team of employees to operate and execute on larger goals Requirements and Skill Sets: . 2+ years of people management experience (hands-on, supervisory background) . 5+ years of data and analytics experience . Prior project management background . Understanding of and experience with SQL . Experience with other various analytics tools and technologies (i.e. Tableau, Python, etc.) . Digital advertising experience a plus . Automotive industry experience a plus CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few. At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

Engineer, Software Engineer, ETL Developer, SQL Developer, IT Technical Project Manager or similar Experience reporting project status, scope changes and critical metrics to all stakeholders including senior and executive management, preferably in an Agile environment Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment through strategic planning, prioritization and task delegation Experience working with complex SQL, ETL technologies (e.g., SSIS, Informatica, Pentaho and DataStage) Experience creating object models and source code in Python/Java/C/C++/GO or other object-oriented programming language Practical experience working with AWS Analytics, AWS Database and AWS Management Tools Experience with data warehouse/lake, data virtualization architecture and BI technologies (such as MicroStrategy, Looker, Tableau or ThoughtSpot) Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate with business stakeholders Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment; ability to identify non-obvious solutions to complex problems Exceptional leadership and organizational skills; ability to there's no daunting hierarchy, "boss" is a four-letter word, and if you work hard, you're the one who will reap the rewards, both personally and professionally. BUSINESS SOLUTIONS ANALYST/MANAGER Shea Homes is looking to hire a Business Solutions expert to join the Finance & Accounting organization. The Business Analyst should be self-motivated, reliable, and willing to learn new technologies while growing technical and business skills within the homebuilding industry. This role will have a strong emphasis in supporting the needs of the business through design and development of actionable analytics, development and maintenance of the BI platform and training and support of the Finance user community. Additionally, this role will creatively engage in other Financial Systems related projects and best practice initiatives that will involve taking business and functional requirements from concept and development through deployment. ROLE PRIORITIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Designs, develops and delivers analytical solutions, resulting in decision support or models; communicates complex and technical results of analysis to stakeholders. Define & develop intuitive reports & dashboards (maintain, improve & develop reporting mechanisms) using Power BI Manage Power BI enhancements, development & support end-user reporting requests Identify actionable insights, provide recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating and advocating findings to cross functional groups Analyze, visualize, harvest and summarize significant amounts of data for analysis and interpretation. Provide insight for analytical objectives and build end-to-end reporting solutions to support company initiatives Significant participant and lead Analyst in design, development and implementation of new forecasting application. Ensure Finance and Accounting projects are designed based on business requirements. Creates detailed test plans, executes, addresses defects, and documents test metrics and results. Leads and facilitates project requirements definition and assists in the preparation of SOW’s (as needed.) Develop detailed system documentation and end user training Independently prioritize and set deadlines to achieve (through implementation, execution, and analysis) and motivated to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance Support, develop and enhance Finance and Accounting Excel templates for efficiency Stay current on the latest industry technologies, techniques, trends and strategies, and implement new findings where applicable. Provide end- user training where necessary. REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Economics, Statistics, or Finance. Related Masters or MBA a plus 5+ years Business Analyst related experience required 3+ years of experience with Business Intelligence tools Proficient with MS Office applications, and demonstrated Advanced Excel skills including PowerPivot/Power Query Strong expertise and functional understanding of the forecasting and budgeting process with experience in business process redesign and/or transformation Track record of managing multiple high-impact and long-term projects either in a Project Manager role or business lead capacity Technical expertise with data modeling and database design Experience with reporting and data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau Technical expertise with data modeling and database design Proficient in SQL with the ability to read and write queries Experience with Oracle EPM tools; Hyperion HFM, Hyperion Planning, Essbase ASO/BSO, and JD Edwards E1 platforms a plus. Demonstrate basic project management skills with advanced communication skills and ability to translate complex concepts between business customers and technical project team. Collaborate with Enterprise Data Technology team in all aspects/needs of Data Warehouse creation and Business Intelligence tool creation Develop understanding of interdependencies between systems, datasets and processes, understand data models and schemas. The ability to multi-task, and manage multiple long term and short-term projects to meet various deadlines simultaneously is required. Impactful. Disciplined. Measurable. That’s why savvy marketers turn to IWCO Direct – to inspire performance across all marketing channels. From all- inclusive creative, digital and paper-based direct mail services to leading technology platforms, advanced postal optimization strategies and industry know-how, IWCO Direct won’t just help you along the way; we’ll Power your Marketing™. IWCO Direct also plays an active role in our communities and works closely with industry partners, the U.S. Postal Service, and our Congressional representatives to build awareness of the mailing industry and its importance to the national economy. If you’re thinking of a new career at IWCO Direct, our pace is fast, but safety, quality and an enriching work environment are top priorities. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package and on-site wellness programs – not to mention the opportunity to work with some of the most talented people around. Description of Duties: The Business Intelligence Analyst manages projects to provide BI insights and tools in order to help IWCO Direct and our clients make better/faster decisions and improve processes. Responsibilities include: Build complex BI solutions (reports and dashboards) by collaborating with technical and business teams: Plan, design, develop, test, and launch efficient business, financial, and operations BI solutions in support of core organizational functions and business processes. This includes gathering requirements, managing beta testing, and training end users. Collaborate with Database Administrators and data owners to understand business requirements, common analysis use cases, and ensure use of accurate and meaningful data sources and databases. Provide user support to provision dashboard data to meet informational/operational objectives. Promote and facilitate the development of self-service capabilities. Create and uphold a BI governance policy: Participate in defining the organization’s data strategy. Define BI roles/responsibilities and appropriate access levels for each role. Define corporate standards (look/feel) and branding of dashboards. Manage access to dashboards and audit dashboards annually for permissions and continuous improvement. Contribute to design and support of BI environment, including information and data acquisition, management and delivery solutions. Manage BI projects: Plan, execute, and finalize projects with clear milestones according to strict deadlines and within budget. This includes coordinating the efforts of team members in order to deliver projects according to plan. Present and communicate BI project requirements, findings and solutions to stakeholders. Provide education to stakeholders on value and use of information and operational data. Define the project's priority, objectives and oversee quality control throughout the project life cycle. Apply communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of BI system investments. Minimum Experience/Education Requirements: Bachelors degree required; advanced degree preferred. 5+ years of experience in directly related positions. Proficient with BI tools (Qlik Sense experience desired), Excel, and SharePoint. Experience with complex data aggregation, relational databases, data schemas and data visualization. Experience managing dashboard implementation projects. Experience implementing and promoting new BI tool. Ability to learn quickly; use data to communicate a call-to-action, communicate technical information to non-technical audience; accept and quickly respond to business changes; must readily adapt to changes in workload and additional time commitments. Must have a high level of analytical and interpersonal skills. Handles sensitive and confidential data/information. Pre-employment drug screen and background check required. Qualifications Education Required Bachelors or better. Preferred Masters or better. Experience Required 5+ years of experience in directly related positions

Who we are At Criteo, we connect 1.4 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our mission is to create an open, transparent and fair marketing ecosystem. With more than $600 billion in annual commerce sales and 600 terabytes of daily shopper data, we deliver performance at scale. And, with over 30 offices across the world, our company DNA is truly international. Do you want to have an impact on more than half of the world’s internet users? Join us and be part of something big. The Analyst role works with senior management to support strategic planning activities by providing actionable recommendations based on assessments of markets and competitors, both existing and potential. Who you'll do Identify, quantify and inform the leadership and corporate strategy teams about threats and opportunities in our markets. Perform ongoing research on competition and market trends to provide competitive analysis and market intelligence on existing and considered new products Develop a clearinghouse for unique external information gathered from the different parts of the company Provide regular intelligence to executives to inform decisions Create and update comprehensive industry and competitor models including but not limited to market share, growth projections and trends, and market forces Perform thorough, systematic analysis of key industry trends; legal and regularory issues; current and potential competitors Maintain corporate dashboards on key trends in our data, up-to-date knowledge of data sources, and leverage them across the company where appropriate Provide market and competitive insights through presentations and reports to various internal management teams to allow effective strategic and tactical decision-making and implementation Identify prospects for M &A; and partnerships Supply the market and competitive intelligence component of strategic planning, and proactively makes recommendations to management concerning key intelligence items that require further consideration. Who you are Strong comprehension of advertising, marketing and/or ecommerce ecosystems, with ability to provide in-depth perspective on technologies, business models, and strategic implications Ideal candidate should have experience in capital markets (eg Equity Research) in their background Communication skills, seniority and holistic understanding of our markets that enable access to unique information whether internally or externally at an executive level Technical analytical skills to investigate our internal data Analytical, synthesis and writing skills enabling effective and actionable reports for leadership team At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo.
